review.reviewBody: Happily I received this comfortable & classy top yesterday.  I added a black top to my collection.  I love the way the fabric is so soft & feels great on my skin.
review.name: So soft

review.reviewBody: Sun protection is a priority. This shirt does that, but it is also cool and comfortable. I bought ut for the pool, but it goes everywhere. Wear it all day for sun protection and it looks great with jeans, capris and shorts. It’s my GoTo shirt this summer!
review.name: Go Everywhere Summer Shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's a great purchase, most of my outdoor clothes are from Columbia. I really feel comfortable wearing their products during hiking and fishing, the material is soft, comfy, fresh and protect my skin from the sun. I am glad to make purchases with them.
review.name: Review about purchase

review.reviewBody: This shirt is AWESOME! I loved it so much I had to buy a few more. You need this shirt, it’s comfy, great quality, &  reasonably priced. Perfect to wear outside to work in or in to town!
review.name: The Perfect Shirt

review.reviewBody: Excellent sunscreen shirt…great fit…nice colors to choose from
review.name: Less sun lotion to use

review.reviewBody: I really liked this shirt but when I washed it and hung it to dry the logo stuck to the front of the shirt and when I pulled it apart there was a nasty sticky spot which I can't remove.
First purchase on this site.  I am a medium in most tops, sometimes a large.  This shirt I purchased in Medium is way too big!  Even with baggy sleeves, the seams are uncomfortable.
review.name: Disappointed
comment:
Thank you for leaving your review. 
We are so sorry to hear the fit was not right for you, as different products do run differently in terms of sizing. Please contact our Customer Care team at (800) 622-6953 and one of our agents would be more than happy to assist you with this issue.

review.reviewBody: Size Medium - I wear a 34D bra,  My waist is 29-30" and hips are about 39".  The medium has a nice loose fit that still provides a good non-boxy shape. It's comfortable.  I don't have any complaints so far.
review.name: Solid shirt for the outdoors

review.reviewBody: I bought this to use at the beach to keep me cool and protected from the sun and it delivered. The extra small size was perfect for me (5'2" 115 lbs) fitting not too baggy but not tight either. It does dry very quickly which is a huge plus.
review.name: Delivers on its promises

review.reviewBody: I like this shirt and it kept me cool in the hot weather. However, I wish it was longer and I wish I would have gone up a size because the shirt runs small.
review.name: Good shirt

name: Tidal II Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Lithium 20L Daypack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Sturdy pack, good room and breaths well on the back. Secure for tools on the outside and lightweight I have two so far.

I just took this pack to Zion Nat'l Park and couldn't have asked for a better bag! Spent 3 days wearing it all day on long hikes without the hip belt, packed with 3L of water, a bunch of snacks, and essentials and never had sore shoulders. I liked how it carried my hiking poles securely during a little scrambling, and thought the back and straps had enough circulation to stay cool even when soaked with sweat. The chest strap was comfortable due to its elastic ease, and the layout of the pockets were ample enough to stay organized, but simple enough to be quick and easy to use. I like how this pack is smaller at the bottom, so the things you hope to not use stay out of the way, and the things you plan on interacting with more don't get lost at the bottom, but stay at the fuller top for quick access with good visibility. Ample space for day hikes. Only improvement I could ask for is softer fabric on the edge of the straps. They rubbed the front of my shoulders a little bit when in a tank top, but honestly it wasn't a big enough deal to knock a star off my rating. Thrilled with my purchase and look forward to trying the hip belt once I have more weight in it!
review.name: Perfect for my needs!

review.reviewBody: I love this small backpack, roomy enough I can pack all my essentials for a short day hike. It feels comfortable on my back and I can also bring this pack anywhere, from the city to the woods.
review.name: Amazing Daypack!!

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and fits enough for my day trip. I like the side wrist pockets for easy access/storage of important items such as phone, key, etc.
Perfect size for a one day outing.  Great for use in town or on the trail.  Best used for travel.  My wife used it as a substitute for her purse when we went on vacation.  She needs her own now.
review.name: Perfect for small adventures

review.reviewBody: Great quality, plenty of space, great color.  Perfect for a day hike
I use this pack daily and it's sturdy, stays clean, and is the perfect size.
review.name: Perfect size for an every day carry

name: Lithium 20L Daypack - Women's

description: Buy the Camp Chef Deluxe 12-Quart Dutch Oven online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Deluxe 12-Quart Dutch Oven
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Deluxe 12-Quart Dutch Oven online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this Dutch Oven for my daughter, who was fulfilling a requirement for her cooking merit badge for the BSA.  We loved it so much, that I ended up purchasing the 12" as well for desserts.  High quality oven...Love it better than Lodge, as far as I'm concerned, and much more reasonable.
review.name: Awesome Dutch Oven

review.reviewBody: I love our dutch oven took it camping with us and loved it. So glad we had it. Thinking about getting next size bigger.
review.name: Dutch oven

review.reviewBody: I got this a few years ago and I like it, BUT the little handle on the lid is too small to get halfway decent sized fingers to grab it...and others have complained about the relative inability of most lid-lifters to really get under it to grab it.   So, I would give it 3 or 4 stars...really a 3.5.  but not a possibility.  Anyway, make sure you get one with  smoooooth interior and no wobble on the lid and you're happy with the size of the lid's handle!
review.name: Great buy the HANDLE ON THE LID is TOO SMALL!

review.reviewBody: Used at a girl scout outing with a liner to bake a chocolate s'mores cake. Did the job, great quality and pre seasoneda
review.name: Premium dutch oven

review.reviewBody: I purchased this stew pot because it was advertised as being 12 qts (3 gallons).  It only holds 2 gallons.  It is also not 14" in diameter.  The inside diameter is only 13".  The outside diameter is 13.5".    The handle is attached in such a way that it never hangs level, so you can never even fill it up to the top.  I would not have purchased it if I had known it only held 2 gallons.
review.name: 1/3 smaller than advertised

review.reviewBody: Camp Chef has a great package here especially if you are starting out in Dutch Oven cooking or just adding a pot. Well made and large enough for those big family gatherings.  The skillet/griddle is great to get prep started and the fact that it is 2 pans is awesome for any cook out. The lid lifter is a wonderful addition. The included groud beef stroginoff recipe was great and my family loved it. I will have to make it again. I use mine for as few as 4-6 servings and as large as 20. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great Package and Oven

name: Deluxe 12-Quart Dutch Oven

review.reviewBody: I've had 2 pairs of the quest 4 in the last 5 years - they have taken me on near daily hikes, the 75km west coast trail, and through winter walks on the east coast. comfortable straight out of the box! never any blisters (which is why I love Salomon). Only reason for  needing a second pair is the sole began to split where it connects to the shoe - the warranty replacement process was super easy. I can't imagine a different boot for hiking long distances, technical terrain, or multi-day use.
review.name: sturdy, reliable, straight out of the box

review.reviewBody: I have found these boots to be very comfortable and so far completely waterproof. Would recommend
review.name: Very comfortable boots

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and well made! Great for multi day backpacking trip! Runs big, order half to one size down
review.name: Durable but runs big

review.reviewBody: I'm a field biologist and I do a lot of off-trail, bushwhacking work.  Plus day hiking on my own time.  This is my fourth or fifth pair of these excellent boots.  They are wide enough in the toe box not to cramp the front of my foot, and I get about 2-3 years out of them, wearing them probably about 50 days a year.  They are very waterproof and supportive.  Please keep making them!
review.name: Very solid, hardworking boot

review.reviewBody: I bought the Quest 4 a year ago and they've been pretty disappointing. I went for Salomon because my olde hiking shoes were Salomon and I loved them. I've literally been in less than 10 hikes with the Quest 4 and they're already falling apart. The shoelace hook is loose and there are loose threads as well. The plastic in the tip of the shoe is also coming off. Very disappointing for such expensive shoes.
review.name: Disappointing
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm to you that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: I invested on a new pair of hiking boots. I went with Salomon, a well respected brand and it really disappointed me. Color is great, boots look cool but when I tried them on for the first time the shoe lace hook got loose. They literally lasted 2 minutes
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Très confortables, bonne adhérence et étanches! J'adore!
review.name: Excellentes bottes de randonnée

review.reviewBody: I own an old pair of Salomon and they fit perfectly, but these are WAAAY too big. I am a 5 and these are more like a 6. Disappointed, will be returning them
review.name: TOO BIG
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
Used to be my go-to hiking boots - have gone through multiple pairs. I noticed other reviews saying these boots no longer fit like they used to and unfortunately I am having the same experience.
11 is too big and 10.5 is too small. Boots are not comfortable to hike in because of this, which is too bad because my last pairs were the perfect hiking boot. Thought I had finally found a boot I could depend on.
I wish they would go back to making them how they used to. I know I’m not the only one who has noticed the difference. Looks like I’m back in the market for a comfortable pair of hiking boots. Disappointed after using Salomon’s quest 4 for over a decade.
review.name: Used to be my favorite boot

review.reviewBody: I have 6 pairs of hiking boots, some more $ and some less. But these are by far the best! Love them and wear almost every day. 😊
review.name: The best!

name: Quest 4 GTX Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Jury is still out on these jeans. I ordered them in the 26 (which is my usual size) and agree with  the other reviewer - I could have gone down at least one size, possibly two. The denim is soft (and also thin if you live in a colder weather state and need warm pants). There are options to adjust the waist with a built in tabs on the waistband. But if you go with the tightest option, the pants do a weird fold-over thing and don't look like normal pants. So, if you can size down, I'd do it. Or if you are good with the waist adjustments and a belt, you might be able to make them work. Also - count on them being a lot wider than they look on the model - these are very exaggerated and they just look kind of relaxed on the images.
review.name: Extraordinarily large

review.reviewBody: I like these jeans, but I sized down and they are have the oversized look to them. I could’ve sized down an additional size and they be slightly more fitted. Still super cute and soft denim material. I’m typically a 28 in jeans but can fit a 27/26 in this style.
review.name: Cute oversized jeans

name: Palmer Cuffed Jean - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Aksel Work Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Warm enough for dog walking in high teens /low 20's F. Haven't tested water proofing yet - will need spring snow conditions for that, but I did give them a double application of Bick LP and a quick flame job to drive it in and water beads and runs off, and it didn't discolor the leather. 

Only drawbacks: there needs to be some rough out or double-stitched leather on the palm and thumb, and the wrist cuff is too tight if you wear a watch.

Will see how durable they are.
review.name: Warm, and starting out tough, but....

review.reviewBody: A couple weeks into wearing these, in the beginning of a wet winter. I've worn them for the usual outdoors work, and general outdoors glove usage, in temps from about 25-40 degrees. They've been totally warm, as long as activity levels are at least at a low-moderate level. Below freezing, they aren't what I'd pick for stationary activities. Water resistance is solid, especially after waxing them, and they seem as tough or tougher than any other work glove I've had. Fit is on the snug side, so if you're hesitating, I might size up. Although, the leather definitely breaks in to your hand. Highly recommended!
review.name: Straightforward and solid

review.reviewBody: Very classy gloves... seem to be wearing the colour off quicker than I would expect though... But, still nice gloves.
review.name: Nice Gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves are very well made. Just as good using them to dig a hole in the cold or driving around a UTV when the windchill is an issue.
review.name: Amazing quality, soft leather

review.reviewBody: A work glove you can hit the slopes with. These gloves have a nostalgic old school feel.
review.name: Work or play

review.reviewBody: Great work gloves for the winter, i have been using them up at the backcountry hut i work at.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: Super rugged gloves. These are going in my trunk for roadside emergencies.
review.name: Super rugged gloves

review.reviewBody: I work on a farm and needed gloves that would keep my hands warm while out in the snow. These worked. Thank you.
review.name: Worth the time and money

review.reviewBody: Ordered a medium and they were snug on my hands but after a few wears super comfortable. These are my go to gloves for most winter days. I'd say they're good for short bouts in -25 but that would be their limit.
review.name: Really like these so far

review.reviewBody: Good all around glove warm and durable needs a little time to break in I like that it has sufficient insulation on the palm.
review.name: Warm and durable

name: Aksel Work Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love the fabric and style, but too small. There are seams inside that feel rough on the fingertips. I have large hands so wish there was an extra large, may have to go over to the men’ side
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I've ordered these before over the years, they are warm. The new style is too narrow even after going up to a large.
review.name: For very skinny hands

review.reviewBody: We measured my wife's hands carefully, and according to the sizing chart she is a small. However the mitts are way too short. Suggesting going up a size. Other than sizing, they seem to be OK. Not worth returning due to shipping costs, we will give them away to someone with smaller hands.
review.name: Sizing chart is not accurate

review.reviewBody: I lost my original pair of these mittens - perfect for general cold weather activities like walking the dog, out for an evening, etc. Sooo glad Outdoor Research is still making them and I was able to get a quick replacement pair!
review.name: BEST Mittens Ever!

review.reviewBody: I love this mitten and have it in a size Large, which is far too big for me though (too wide). Sadly the medium is ridiculously small in comparison (too narrow and thumb/web area not long enough) and had to be returned. It's great for running in below freezing temps, when there is also wind. Wish they would re-work the sizing because it should also be unisex, and not just women's (or offer a men's sizing version).
review.name: sizing issues, but great for cold windy running!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these gloves and mittens (have both)-- I thought I had lost the mittens so checked to make sure OR still offered them. Thankfully still here!! They are great when you only need lightweight warmth to take the edge off. Plus hand warmers fit perfectly in the mittens. Please don't stop offering them.
review.name: perfect lightwt gloves and mittens

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Much thinner than expected and pilled after two wearings. Don't waste your money.
review.name: Flimsy

review.reviewBody: These are nice light mittens, but be careful with the sizing.  I have the similar OR flurry glove which I really like and assumed the sizing (S in gloves) would be the same, but in the mittens they were too small.  The Small in the mittens is REALLY small, so adjust accordingly.
review.name: Watch the sizing... runs small

review.reviewBody: In the winter of 2022 I set out on an expedition in far Northern Quebec, starting in March and ending in April. I would travel with 14 others, and we would have one resupply. I had been preparing for almost a full year, which included a LOT of research on the best clothing to bring. But as with most trips, the final gear sort was very rushed. I mistook my girlfriend's flurry mitts for my own mittens, and packed them in my bag. By the time I realized my mistake I was sitting in a cozy Gaspe hostel, too far in to buy new mittens. So I dealt, and made it through with all my 10 fingers perfectly happy. I layered up with a pair of ski gloves and waterproof overmitts, but most of the insulation I got was from these mittens. Luckily temperatures were fairly balmy, rarely dropping below -20 degrees and my overmitts kept my hands well protected from the wind. I fell in the snow plenty, wore through my ski gloves, nearly lost a mitten behind my backpack, but I could always rely on these flurry mitts to keep my hands warm. I don't think I would've kept all my fingers without them. They were comfy, dried quickly, fit well enough (though I had no choice in the size), and were easily recognizable - being the lightest mittens in the tent. Even though I never intended to bring my girlfriend's flurry mitts on a subarctic expedition, I am so glad that I did.
review.name: Mittens accidentally survived two months in the subarctic.

review.reviewBody: I purchase a new pair of these mitts yearly. Not because of quality issues, but because the quality, fit and feel are so great I can't get enough of them. I keep a pair at work, in the car, in the house and in my ski bag. I wish there was a broader colour choice.
review.name: Favourite OR mits

name: Flurry Mitten - Women's

review.reviewBody: Cages look great on the bike.  Bottles are easy to get in and out, yet are still held securely in the cage.
review.name: Nice Bottle Cage

review.reviewBody: Recently bought two Matrix Team Water Bottle Cages by Lezyne. Not only are these cages lightweight and strong, but the design is simple and flows nicely. The cages hold the water bottles tightly.
review.name: Great Cage

review.reviewBody: These bottle cages have been great for my road bike! I've had a couple issues in the past with other bottle cages with them breaking and just quickly wearing down after frequently taking bottles in and out, but these have had no issues, and they also have a nice clean look to match my bike perfectly, which is always a win! Would recommend for anyone looking for a bottle cage for their road bike or hardtail mountain bike. As for a full suspension mountain bike, something like a side-load cage may be a better fit.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Best boots ever. They do not slip and are waterproof. I just love them. I bought my husband and daughter a pair I loved them so much
review.name: Love these boots
comment: Thanks for the love!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these! I went to Patagonia, walked on a glacier, got in waterfalls, walked on rocks and they did not get my feet wet, they were super sturdy and amazing quality!!
review.name: Waterproof and comfortable! Even in Patagonia
comment: Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these on vacation when we decided to do a hike.  I did size up as others mentioned they run small.  I did a 7 mile hike right out of the box.  I was glad I purchased them.  It was a steep incline and the terrain was rocky and muddy at points.  They were comfortable and offered good ankle support.  Even had other hikers compliment me and ask where I purchased I them when passing by.  Can’t wait for my next hike!
review.name: Great Boot

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had to order twice as a half-size larger was still too small. Exchanging was free, easy and quick. As soon as I got the 2nd pair and confirmed they fit well, I set out on a three-mile hike with a couple of my dogs. The boots were comfy and exactly what I needed.
review.name: Great boot but had to order 1 full size up

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this boot last year at the end of winter season, I haven't had a chance to wear it yet, until this past weekend. My husband and I attended an extremely muddy/wet festival - we were on our feet all day, all weekend. Though we didn't go hiking, we did do A LOT of walking through deep thick mud and giant puddles of water. It was mess, but you know what wasn't a mess - my feet and joints! I have mild/mod arthritis that affects most of my body, and I had little to no pain the next day. These shoes were so comfortable, kept my feet dry and supported, and were easy to clean up when we got home. Would highly recommend. Sad I waited months to finally use them.
review.name: Comfortable, and Stable

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these a couple months ago and tried to break them in before a 72 mile thru hike - thought I did it, but ended up with intense blisters on my toes, inside of my arch, and outside heel. Keep an eye on if you have wide feet, the toe box ended up being too narrow.
review.name: Loved at first

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve never gone hiking a day in my life, I bought these for a trip to the smoky mountains and they are incredible. My feet did not hurt once, they had great ankle support and super cute. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE!
review.name: Worth every penny

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fit, waterproof and goid grip on slippery trails.
review.name: Best hiking boots for the Camino de Compostela!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are the best! I hiked 12 miles in one day and my feet barely hurt.
review.name: Best Boots Ever!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I took these to Red Rock Canyon. They gripped the rock and were quite comfortable. The tongue seemed to be 'unfinished' like what others commented. I think that might just be the design. It doesn't bother me & maybe it makes the boot more breathable? All in all I'll keep them for future hiking trips.
review.name: Good hiking boot

name: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Radix 47L Backpack - Men's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Ive had this for a couple weeks now, so not a lot of use so far. Loaded with a 24hr kit (~20lbs) it carries great. Fit and finish are very good, all seams and stitching are tight and straight. The compression strap buckles are somewhat small, so will be interesting to see how those hold up. But the fact the straps are removable is great, you can easily change them out for something heavier in event of failure. Hip belt pockets are a little small, but well placed with easy to operate zippers.
The adjustable torso length is easy to use and works well. Hip belt fits well, with lots of length available to go from being in shorts to full winter kit.
review.name: New purchase, Imitially looks great!

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this pack.  I have this and the Radix 57 as well, and several other packs from MR.  All of them carry a load amazingly well, and all are very durable.  The Radix series is great for backpacking, they're light and extremely well built and thought out.  This line has everything I need, carries loads extremely comfortably for a long time, and isn't overburdened with overdesigned pockets, zips, compartments, etc.  A really versatile, well-designed backpacker's dream.
review.name: Mystery Ranch Durability -- Light Weight!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack about 6 months ago for a through hike around Mt. Blanc in France.  I trained carrying a 45 lbs load six miles roundtrip up and down a peak by my house with 2500' vertical gain.  After probably 50 up and downs for training and then the through hike of 100 miles around the Trail Du Mont Blanc, I must say this pack does not disappoint.  I honestly have nothing negative.  Every time I thought a feature was silly or didn't work I found an opportunity to use it later on. 
-The top is large and spacious with a huge pocket.  The extra waterproof durable zipper holds everything in and keeps it dry.  
-Large internal pocket with a nice side zipper when you need it. I also like the cinch strap and the over latch that fits really well. 
-Exterior is perfect. From hanging wet socks in the pole holders to cramming rain gear and water bottles on the outside.  I also stuck in micro trax in the pockets for quick use on snow travel. 
-Straps are super comfortable (make sure you follower their sizing and fitting videos!).  Back piece is comfortable and breathes perfect.  
My last thought is I highly recommend the zoid bags.  I bought the small black on for extra quick stuff at the top (headlamp, inreach, etc...) and then my toiletries went in the big orange on the sipper side of the bag.  Get the clear ones...they are time savers!
This is an amazing bag.  I looked a lot of other bags....a lot of other bags.  I ultimately pulled the trigger with Mystery Ranch because they stood by their product.  However, I got quite the chuckle when I rolled into Chamonix on day 8 of being on the trail hiking anywhere from 12-22 miles a day in snow and rain, and my bag still looked brand new! So the ultimate downfall is you don't get any street cred for a tattered roughed up bag because it is bomber.  Highly recommend, five stars, you won't regret!
review.name: The Perfect Pack!

review.reviewBody:
In the field: the bag is quickly forgotten, the comfort is incredible (better than the Osprey Aether which for me is one of the benchmarks in terms of comfort despite more padding on the Osprey) but that is specific to each person of course. I think the independent RADIX belt must play a role? Maybe, in any case the comfort is fantastic. 

Sorry for the broken English, I use google translate
review.name: Amazing backpack

review.reviewBody: Great fitting pack (men's Large frame) that keeps load balanced and centered well.
review.name: Great fit, weight

review.reviewBody: Well made with a ton of features. Carries heavy loads well (heavy for camping and hiking).
review.name: Radix 47

review.reviewBody: I bought this for multi type backpacking, lite, durable, great organization outside pockets. Definately recommend if you are looking for a lite pack for backpacking or day hikes.
review.name: Lite weight, Great pockets for outside gear!

review.reviewBody: I got this in just in time for a week-long Alpine Medicine course in Slovenia. It packed all my gear (and extra team gear) easily and made it feel like a quarter of the weight it really was. The pack held up well through days in deep snow, and even when placed the snow nothing inside ever got wet. The three large exterior pockets were spacey, and the center exterior pocket fit the avalanche rescue kit (shovel, probe, and ice axe) perfectly. The top admin pocket holds way more than it looks, and the interior of the pack loads easily, especially with the full-length zipper. I could not be happier with this pack.
review.name: Amazing Pack All Around

name: Radix 47L Backpack - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not sure why they market these as a waterproof shoe, the first puddle I put a toe in resulted in wet feet. They are comfortable enough, the insoles were all wonky and unevenly inserted when they arrived, but once I fixed that I was fine. But definitely do not buy these if you need them to keep you dry.
review.name: These are in no way waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair of Anacapa GTX. My original pair were great, lasted many miles & a wet trip thru Iceland. Thise Anacapa 2 not so much. A walk thru wet grass at the park & my socks are soaked,especially the toe box. They would never hold up to trail hiking in wet conditions. Very disappointed that I have to return.
review.name: Not Waterproof at all

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Hiked on these for 3 weeks in the Dolomites. Comfortable. Good grip even on wet limestone. Great shoe to accommodate wide toe box. Maybe a bit too large, wore thicker socks. Works great for general hiking and as easy approach shoe. But the sole is too soft for via ferrata or scrambling. My foot placements held, but they were sloppy, leaning, not 100% solid. Handled scree, steep slopes, rock, grass all okay just not solid enough for more technical. Goretex kept socks dry even in rain and snow.
review.name: Great hiking shoes for general use but too soft for ferrata

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Thank you for offering a wide in this shoe. Appreciate rain resistant. Using these in Dolomites hiking. Good grip even on polished limestone. But not great for via ferrata, too flexible, not a solid enough edge. For moderate difficulty via ferrata okay, used arms, legs to compensate but harder via ferrata the lack of structural stability of shoe was an issue. Switched to other more rigid shoes. For hiking great but above that becomes problematic.
review.name: Great but not for via ferrata

author.name: Like to hike but getting older

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been buying Hokas for many years. After having a tendon tear in my foot several years ago I need wide shoes. I have been waiting for a waterproof hiking shoe in a wide for... Well, what seems like forever. I really wanted to love these shoes, but the tongue is too long and rubs on my ankle. Also unlike the other styles of wide shoes, these seem to be much wider. Why are there so few waterproof Hokas in wide? So disappointing they'll have to go back
review.name: Why!!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I originally ordered a pair of Skyline Float X hikers, but they felt a little too small & sort of cheap-feeling. Then I found the Anacapa's. They were on sale, so significantly cheaper than the Skylines. I wasn't sure about the brownish color, but for the price I decided to try them & ordered them 1/2 size bigger than the Skylines. They are SO comfortable - wore them for the first time the other day on a 1.5 hour mountain hike & no problems at all. And I think the color looks nicer in person than online. I also feel like these were a better value than the Skylines b/c they contain some genuine leather & are Gortex. They feel more sturdy & well-made, like a hiking shoe rather than a tennis shoe. I would definitely recommend.
review.name: Comfy hikers

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I would not buy this product again. Balance is wonderful, but the product is too wide and that is uncomfortable. My heal gets sore at times where the top rolls up.
review.name: No I would not.

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear hoka shoes everyday, and can't say enough about how great they are. So when I needed a pair of hiking shoes for vacation , I immediately went to hoka . Com , and found exactly what I was looking for. Couldn't be happier with them.
review.name: Hiking with Hoka

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Purchased these ANACAPA 2 shoes for walking and hiking. Soooo comfy for a walk but also comfy and substantial for everyday use.
review.name: These are AWESOME

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Waited to send a review until I broke my sneakers in. They are great for a girl with a lot of foot problems. I don't even need my orthopedic inserts. Lots of room in the toe box and cushion support with each step. First time wearing this brand and I love them.
review.name: Great support

name: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aoede 22L Briefpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aoede 22L Briefpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aoede 22L Briefpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The bag is built with quality. It has so much space for packing and works great for traveling. I felt I had so much space no matter how I packed it. The different carry options are great as well.
review.name: Great For Travel

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a bag that is exactly this, brief, backpack and duffle options around 20-25L. Basically something like a smaller version of the Thule Subterra 40L. I looked at several bags such as Timbuk2 Scheme, Briggs&Riley ZDX, Everymans Hideout, and Thule boarding (which doesn't have a backpack). 

The Aoede seems the closest to what I was looking for in looks, functionality and price range. It is minimalistic, sleek, simple to use and lightweight, and the materials are of course great. 
However, it lacks some features can could be easily implemented by a company like Osprey and improve the bags functionality.

Structure: The bag does not have padding in the front compartment, meaning it has more give to pack but does not keep its structure. This is mostly annoying when using the upper handle as the bag collapses and loses it shape. This does not happen with the Thule Subterra for example that has a more rigid structure .

Laptop: the compartment doesn't have anything that keep the laptop fixed, there is a pocket which is not padded. I feel that for a small bag it would make sense to have some sort of placement specifically for the laptop. The padding is ok but feels like the computer is just going to be moving around. There is no additional pockets for tech, even a small zipped pocket would make sense. This compartment opens as an L, which allows access in horizontal or vertical position, but why not just make it a U ? 

Main compartment: opens as a suitcase which is great but no pockets or mesh (which other bags do offer). If the bag is intended as a travel and everyday use, you might store some cloths or shoes. having a mesh (as in the thule and ZDX) would have made it so much more functional. Maybe a couple of mesh pockets?

Organization compartment: very basic, oriented as a backpack. it is a choice that the designers have to do, but the ZDX and Scheme have brief type of organization. This bag is called Briefpack, so you would expect it to be accessible as a brief...or some other solution that works for both modalities.

No padded pocket for phone or glasses: the quick access pocket is not really protective, nor very soft. Again, as a travel bag, you would expect to have a safe place to put you phone for example. Just a little bit of padding on the front panel would have solved that

No secret pocket: So there's no RFID pocket, which many travel bags do have now days (ZDX has two). The only "safe" pocket the bag has is inside the backack zipper, which is ok when the straps are tucked but not otherwise. Why not add a pocket under the luggage sleeve? (As the subterra has). As well as a place for an airtag (that could go in the main compartment), 

Backpack straps: The straps are comfortable, no sternum strap which is too bad... no elastics to keep the dangling tidy. 

Shouder strap: it is comfortable, however, the padding is very small and when shortened there is no way to put it in the middle which is kind of weired.

Key leash: not really functional as it doesn't extend or detach easliy, you might as well just put the keys in a pocket.

Overall: I find the idea of the bag really great, I think that the minimalistic concept overpowered its functionality. As a consumer it just seems like a "lazy" implementation, the inside compartment feel a bit cheap (although it's probably made of good materials, it doesn't feel as such).

If this bag had an inner mesh, better structure, better organization with some extra pockets, sternum strap and better design for the laptop compartment it would have been a truly great bag. 
At its current version I would describe it as OK and a bit disappointing in terms of functionality. 

I hope Osprey takes these comments to improve the bag.
review.name: Great concept, lacking implementation. (Hopefully Osprey will take feedbacks...)

review.reviewBody: The u-zip design allows you to store textbooks using the full footprint of the backpack, as opposed to stacking textbooks back to back on regular backpacks and ending up with a bulky backpack, thus the center of gravity is closer to your body and the backpack is easier on your back.
review.name: Great for carrying textbooks

name: Aoede 22L Briefpack

review.reviewBody: Bogs are the most comfortable work boots I have ever owned. We work on our ranch fixing fence, working cattle, etc and I wear them everywhere. I only had to replace mine because my new puppy got ahold of them, apparently they are also tasty! Ha Ha!
review.name: Best boots!

review.reviewBody: I live on a working ranch, these boots are the best!
review.name: Best boots!

review.reviewBody: I have a hard time finding a women's size 12 in most shoes, but particularly boots. These Classics fit the bill! They're comfortable and I feel safe outdoors in them. They're also super cute! Thankyou Bogs!
review.name: An awesome boot

review.reviewBody: I live on acreage in FL. After a year of tough wear, these passed every test. They are fantastic! Tolerate the FL heat, cushioning every step, keeping feet dry.
review.name: Tough and remarkably comfortable

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, best work boots I own! Love that they're roomie so you can wear thicker socks in cold weather. Easy on and off when messy. Also keep feet super warm in wet and cold weather but not too hot during the rest of the year either. A+
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: These are the nicest chore boots I've ever had! I had to break them in at first but after about a week or so they are so perfect. I highly recommend!
review.name: Comfortable Chore Boots

review.reviewBody: Use them every day in the yard, and love them. Easy on, keep my feet protected, warm and dry.
review.name: Love Bogs so much I now have 4 pairs

review.reviewBody: I'm scoring a 1 because I had to exchange the boots and it's been an excessive amount of time and I still have not received the replacement size.
review.name: Runs, Small, Excessive Exchange Time

review.reviewBody: These boots are just what I was looking for after the soles of a competitors boot fell off. Knowing the soles and boot are all one caught my eye. I'm so happy with them.
review.name: Fashionable and functional

review.reviewBody: They're a bit bulky, but I'm sure they'll be good quality. My only gripe is that they don't make half sizes, so I wasn't sure which size to get. I'm glad I sized up because then I'd have to pay for return or exchange shipping, which would've stunk.
review.name: Bulky but cute

review.reviewBody: It's happened before, and I should have known not to buy pants without an inseam option. I'm 6'4", 205 and typically wear a size 33 waist. I got these in a 34. They fit a little big in the waist (which was to be expected), but they are exceptionally short in the inseam. The inseam on the pants i received measured at 30", not 32". It may be okay for some, but pants that stop 2 inches above my ankle just aren't my style. No huge deal though, got these for work and not to be stylish. I knew they'd be covered in grease and dirt  within 24 hours of delivery. Should have paid more heed to other reviews regarding inconsistent sizing. If they came in a tall size, or had an inseam option, I would 100% buy them again as work pants.
review.name: Not for tall guys

review.reviewBody: There charge $6.99 for any type of return. It's so deep hidden in their policy. They are very much misleading people when they say 100% guaranteed returns.
review.name: Return policy is bad
comment: We understand your frustration with the return shipping fee. We strive to be transparent with our return policy and have sent you an email with further details.

review.reviewBody:
These pants check every one of my boxes. Comfy fit. Slight stretch. Durable materials. Phone pocket. They sized as expected for me.

My only complaint is around dye holding color. I've had mine for about 6 months, worn them more than any other pant in that time. But in that 6 months, the brown is already fading. I've had other pants that lasted 5 years with a similar amount of fading.

All things considered, these are 100% worth it if you can grab them on sale for $40, and I'll probably try to grab a second pair someday, but the $100 price is ludicrous.
review.name: Love 'em

review.reviewBody: These things look and feel great. I started with just the starfish color but loved them so much I had to get the others. I wear a size 38 and all of them have fit perfectly and consistently. Highly recommend!
review.name: My favorite pants

review.reviewBody: I have three pairs of these pants. One is my absolute favorite pair of pants and the other two might as well be completely different. They're all supposed to be 32s but the leg length and groin area fit wildly different. It's a shame. Also, the starfish color feels like a lighter fabric than my black ones.
review.name: Horribly inconsistent

review.reviewBody: Very well made and comfortable. I bought Outdoor Research pants, and these are way better.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody:
I love these pants. Ordered every color. Extremely comfortable and versatile! But the sizing is really inconsistent. My black pair is totally 1 to 2 sizes bigger than what the tag says. After washing and drying them several times to try to shrink them a bit to fit, it’s very clear that they were never actually a size 28– probably a 30 or 32. Super unfortunate because I can’t return them :/
All of the other colors do fit.. However, I wouldn’t say the fit is consistent in each.
review.name: Love these BUT sizing…

review.reviewBody:
there is no consistency in the fit. i first ordered a size 32, which measured 18" laid flat (36" circumference): too big. so i ordered a 30, which measured 16". a 2" size drop but a 4" circumference drop: too small. so i ordered another 32. this one measured a little over 16" laid flat, so the same as the 30, and 4" less in circumference than the other pair of 32s i bought. i give up.

they seem like good pants. i wish i could get a pair that fit.
review.name: highly random fit

review.reviewBody: I love these pants, they're comfortable, great price, and the color is great in the green. My only downside is that they have a lot of stretch, my waist is small compared to my thighs and this makes my waist size bigger, that said it's hard to keep the pants comfortably up while longboarding. They catch my thighs and calves a lot and I end up re-adjusting a lot, for people not addicted to deadlifts these are perfect.
review.name: Great Pants, Almost Too Stretchy

review.reviewBody: My bf loves these pants! He is usually a 34 but sometimes needs to size up to a 36 so I would say these may run slightly big. He is 6'2 , 220lbs athletic build, and hates tight feeling pants!!). These in the size 34 are great for him and have a stretch to them. These are his new favorite pants. Very flattering! Could be work pants or even dressed up more for a casual or "put together" outfit. Love the brown color that isn't in stock anymore. I am just now purchasing the grey pair.
review.name: Great fit. Flexible.

name: Rambler Stretch Workpant - Men's

description: Buy the Kelty Grand Mesa 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Grand Mesa 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Grand Mesa 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this tent to use as an easy, affordable part of my car camping setup, and it serves its purpose well

The tent is easy to set up and take down quickly. The materials and construction are sturdy. The rain fly goes on and off easily, keeps the tent rigid and stable in wind, and the tent stays dry, warm, and free of condensation under the fly. I slept through some rain without issue.

The vestibule is modest. Not a problem for me since I car camp and only stash my shoes in the vestibule while I sleep, but there wouldn't be much extra room in there to rummage through a multi day backpack, let alone two people's packs. It would work, but if you know you like extra space there isn't much to spare here. 

The included stakes are pretty sturdy for base level stakes, I haven't bent any of them during setup (I use a hammer) and they held well in wind. I don't feel like I need to upgrade them for my purposes at this point. 

One thing before buying for yourself, be aware of the dimensions of the tent and know how much space you need, this tent might not provide it for you. It is advertised as a two person tent, but there is only just enough room for me to be comfortable, I am 6'1, 200lbs and I use a 3" thick sleeping pad, and due to the angle of the tent walls my head or toes just slightly touch the walls when I fully stretch out. I used my friends grand mesa 2 before my purchase and knew what I was getting and it works for me, but if you are taller or use a taller sleeping setup or sleep with another person/dog/gear or like to do something other than lay down and sleep in your tent, you might consider a tent with a bigger footprint

All in all, the tent is very practical and functional for the price point. I don't feel like I'm missing out on anything for what I paid.
review.name: Top value budget tent

review.reviewBody:
I bought this tent for a motorcycle trip. 
It fit in my sissy bar bag and set up was nice and easy, It held up to some light rain and did not get everything soaked. 
Was affordable, from a reputable brand, and had a nice small size packed up.
review.name: Does not suck

review.reviewBody: Have not had the tent out on a trip yet but did set it up just to check it out. Very easy setup and all but the poles seemed to be well made. The poles I don’t expect them to hold up, just not impressed with them so I’ve already ordered some replacements.
review.name: Unused

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th Kelty tent, love all of them, durable and has never leaked during a rain storm.  You can't beat Kelty for the money.
review.name: Mesa 2 person Tent

review.reviewBody:
I bought this tent on Cyber Monday 2021 to use for Kayak Camping this coming summer.   I have not used it, but I have set it up just to make sure there aren't any major defects. 

I understood when I purchased the tent that it wouldn't be a true bathtub floor, but it was fully seam sealed.  Since Kelty is supposed to be a better brand, I still expected the floor itself to be one piece even if there were seams between the floor & the sides.  I was surprised to find a seam running from side to side across the tent closer to the foot end.  It's sealed, but still a disappointment.  If they're trying to sell more footprints, then it's working since I have already decided to purchase one before my first trip.

Another thing that was disappointing were the tent pole clips.  They were not the twist-style clips that were advertised on every website I used to research this tent.  Additionally, there are not 2 clips anchoring the peak as advertised.  Instead there is only one clip at the peak & it is the same style as the rest of the pole clips.  While it's the same clip system as other Kelty tents such as the Late Start, this very much seems like an update made to cheapen up the production process.

I am going to keep the tent & hope for the best since I got a good deal on it & I will not be an extremely heavy user.
review.name: A Little Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
My old Kelty 4 man purchased in 1998 finally bit the dust it was an awesome tent. Eventually the rain fly kept sticking to itself and I couldn't remedy it. 22 years, not a bad run. Anyways... I've taken the new one here on a few canoe camping trips and it's awesome! A little tight for 2 people but roomy for 1. I'm amazed how tents have evolved and for the price, you can't beat it.

It's so easy and fast to set up/ take down. Lots of ventilation excellent for summer camping.

Probably too heavy for backpacking but excellent for canoeing or car camping!
review.name: Great Replacement Tent

name: Grand Mesa 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: I ordered the XXL. They didn't fit me. I used the RAB sizing chart prior to ordering and they should have fitted but didn't even come close. I'm a big guy but not massive, the sizing seems very small. Unfortunately they had to be returned and I'm forced to find quality down pants from another manufacturer that caters for larger guys. Very disappointing and I think RAB needs to look seriously at this.
review.name: I ordered the XXL. They

review.reviewBody: I was looking for an added layer for winter fishing / camping and came across these .  They are like stepping to a cloud of warmth !  Super warm and very happy.  I'm 6'3 215 athletic build with a 34-35 inch waist and got a size XL.  I can fit layers underneath and they fit  nicely around the waist .  Highly recommend for anyone looking to add superior warmth to their layering game .
review.name: Cloud of Warmth

review.reviewBody: Just as warm as I was hoping, Men’s Argon Down Pants have been the perfect buy for me. I have Reynauds Syndrome which means the blood supply to my extremities shuts down when my core temperature changes. Combined with layered RAB Women’s Down Parkas, the Argon Down Pants can keep the blood flowing to my fingers & toes this winter, indoors and outdoors.
review.name: Just as warm as I

review.reviewBody: A very good product, keeping me warm while packing down to a small size
review.name: A very good product, keeping

review.reviewBody: I hired these trouser via the rab rental service for a 4 day hik in the cairngorms. I used them at night and around the campsite and kept me nice and toasty the whole time. Would 100% recommend.
review.name: Sooooo bloody warm

review.reviewBody: These down trousers are perfect for around camp . They are very comfy and keep you warm
review.name: These down trousers are perfect

review.reviewBody: I have the ghost whisperer and stretchdown down pants from mountains hardware.  These one are much puffier and just overall more comfortable.  I'm 6"4 210 and my waist is 33-35 depending on brand and I'm glad I went with XL here.  L which indicates 34 " for RAB would be too tight!
review.name: The most comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
The down pants are exactly as described. However, I should advise that the waist sizing is very honest. I had to return the first pair and order the next size up. The new pair are a comfortable fit.
The DPD delivery worked well as described on the website.
review.name: The down pants are exactly

review.reviewBody: I'm 5ft 11" slim build ordered large size, fitted well apart from the waist which was ridiculously small !!!!, if I had 28" waist I might of just got the button done up! I buy a lot of Rab gear and always fit well, but this size was way out, very very disappointed
review.name: Very bad Sizing

description: Buy the Burley Piccolo 7-Speed Trailercycle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Piccolo 7-Speed Trailercycle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Piccolo 7-Speed Trailercycle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My 5 year old friggin loves this thing. Just need her to figure out how to push her own weight…..
review.name: Slick little rig

review.reviewBody:
Our six year old isn’t able to ride a bike on her own for various reasons. The Burley
Piccolo has helped her feel comfortable and confident on a bike. Our family loves to ride bikes together, my daughter is building her skills for future independent bike riding, all with an ingenious product that is stable, safe, and easy to use. You won’t regret this purchase!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: My significant other bought this product so that our 6 year old daughter could go on bike rides with him and be safe. She absolutely loves it and that is something they do to stay active and healthy as well as being able to do something they both like to do.
review.name: My significant other bought this

review.reviewBody:
The Piccolo is the best solution we have found for the grandkids. We have two of them, on two different bikes.

Boys can do longer and more fun rides not getting tired. We now take the 5 yr. and 8 yr. old on rides up to 25 miles. The advantages of learning gears, pace at higher speeds and experiencing navigation of tricky off road routes, will translate into better riders when they are older.
review.name: Family Ride

review.reviewBody: Fantastic trail bike for my 5yr old. He had little interest in balancing and pedaling a kids bike, but the Piccolo was a great choice. He can just hop on learn to ride right out of the gate. We rode the 1st day. Great bike.
review.name: Great bike!

review.reviewBody: So much fun! Ride with my 4 yo and it’s very stable. Just awesome!
review.name: So fun

review.reviewBody: We love our Piccolo! My 5 year old has mild cerebral palsy, so balance and strength are challenges for him. But with the Piccolo, we can go on family bikes rides and he doesn’t get left behind. It is very stable and he feels safe and comfortable. I’m impressed on stable it feels pulling him, especially since he still uses training wheels on his solo bike and doesn’t have bike balance figured out yet. Definitely recommend the Piccolo!
review.name: We love our Piccolo! My

review.reviewBody: I recommend the piccolo bike, it is perfect for my 5 yr old who hasn't even learned how to ride a bike yet. No complaints.
review.name: I recommend the piccolo bike,

review.reviewBody:
I had been waiting for the Burley Piccolo to arrive in stock and finally it did just in time for Christmas! 
We have 4 children and love to go for long bike rides but get nervous keeping them all safe and for long distances our newly turned 5 year old can get tired. This is perfect! She gets to peddle and work on balance and has gears! Super easy to take on and off! Highly recommend.
review.name: Well made, great product!

review.reviewBody: Well engineered system. Performs exceptionally. Perfect for building confidence, strength and stamina of young riders. Also allows for main rider to receive a quality ride with ease and worry free. We love it!
review.name: Brilliant!

name: Piccolo 7-Speed Trailercycle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This unit checks all the marks for our family. We love this hybrid board and that everyone can use it how they like. Beautiful quality build, and mindful features. Highly recommend.
review.name: Perfect Family Board

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s great for grandkids and I. Good for just me. Easy to take any where.
review.name: grandkids and I

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Omg I’m so excited can we take a moment to rave about all the places to attach items for all day adventures. The fact that I can paddleboard and kayak in the same day is pretty epic. Not to mention that the bag has WHEELS and POCKETS
review.name: It has Pockets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As it is currently in the middle of the winter in the Pacific Northwest, all I can say is that I purchased this as an upgrade for my wife. I own another model of Bote, and the quality is outstanding. Based on on the looks out of package, this board will not disappoint,. and the quality is continued in the Bote family. We are looking forward to warmer weather so we can float.
review.name: A quality upgrade for wife.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great board. Wish it had a paddle keeper thing in the front
review.name: Great board. Wish it had

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the lowrider! It's easy to carry, get in and out of the water.
review.name: I love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm brand new to paddle boarding, but I've kayaked for years and this was a great way for me to try something new with a product that I could use either way. I'm loving paddle boarding so far, and the board is easy to store, transport, and feels great on the water!
review.name: I'm brand new to paddle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my board! At 10’ 6” it is big enough for me, and I can carry it which makes it easy getting to the water. When you step on the board, you cannot believe that it is an inflatable board—- it feels so solid. I bought the seat so I can sit down and kayak when I feel like it! Love how easy it is to get out on the water and to pack up when I’m finished!
review.name: I love my board! At

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While we certainly haven't mastered using it, we find it to be comfortable, easy to set up and disassemble and family friendly
review.name: Family gift

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This hybrid SUP is very versatile and very stable. With plenty of d rings and connection points it makes taking along whatever gear you want very easy. This complete package is well worth the money.
review.name: Versatile and Functional Board

name: LowRider Aero 10ft 6in Inflatable Stand-Up Paddleboard

review.reviewBody: The waist is all but useless on these, perhaps cost cutting on elastic and ineffective narrow corded. Unable to return them.
review.name: Ineffective wait
comment:
Hi Nick! 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. 
We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We will be sure to pass on your feedback to the relevant department. 
We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using them for a month and are the best shorts I’ve ever had
review.name: Great features!

review.reviewBody: Just ran a 25K trail race, they were great.  Phone pocket held phone tight, used the back pocket for car keys. Used a Salomon running belt for everything else.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Terrible design. Waist not able to cinch properly.
review.name: Worst Salomon product I've owned
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody:
Like the look of them , Not sure on size  , so checked with size chart , Recommended a XL - how wrong was this , worm them Once only , just completely the wrong size , kept falling down on trail run , Now about to sell them 

Never again will I buy Salomon clothing
review.name: Size all wrong
comment: Thanks for getting in touch with us here at Salomon. We are disappointed to hear of this issue with the sizing, as our sizes are standardized, and generally fit well across all users. This review will be passed to our department immediately to review our sizing guidelines.

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love these I was hoping they would be my Marathon shorts for October , they look great, are quality construction, light weight and generally comfortable. 

But, the liner and waist don’t align to size.  Both need to be tighter and offer some compression and support.  Without that compression the weight of a phone makes them sag which is uncomfortable and the phone does not stay put. 


Bottom line buy for the looks not the performance. Maybe size down but for me 5’9” 165lb . I have never fit into a small
review.name: Look great but liner not sized right
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.reviewBody: These are potentially top shorts from Salomon with a really sharp clean design and colourway. Concuring with others however, I find the inner tights way too loose and thigh pocket not able to hold anything securely. To minimise this I ordered a size probably a bit small for me, but that didn’t help. As an extra frustration the waist hem has barely any flexibility, and the draw chord not very effective so they are hard to get on, yet still loose in the inner! It’s as if nobody at Salomon actually tried these on when prototypes.
review.name: Missed opportunity

review.reviewBody: This is the second pair of these I've bought. They're great for running, lots of pockets just the right size and really comfortable. They're my go-to running shorts for all weathers!
review.name: Awesome running shorts

review.reviewBody: I've had some great shorts from Salomon over the years but I bought these for the phone pocket and it doesn't do the job. The pocket looks secure but the inner liner can't take the weight of a phone when you're moving and indeed mine dropped out twice on a short run. Even when it was secure at the start of the run it moved about too much and rubbed my leg. They are comfortable shorts and I am sure will otherwise be ok, but as I bought them for the phone pocket, I wouldn't buy them again. I will return the second unworn pair I have.  I hope Salomon improve the design as a short with a phone pocket would be extremely useful. I had the same problem as the previous reviewer too - as my 'nickname' was the same as someone else's the system deleted what I had written and I had to type the whole review again. Salomon you need to address this or some people simply won't leave reviews.
review.name: Phone pocket a failure
comment:
Thank you for your review, we apologize for the issue that have occurred with your Cross 2 in 1 shorts. Be informed that we have sent you email to continue with the dialogue.

Best regards, Karl

review.reviewBody: Good quality short,  however…I ordered two pairs of the same shorts just in diff colours both in medium size. One pair fitted well, the other pair totally different fitting. Disappointed tbh.
review.name: Same shorts - 2 diff sizes it appears
comment:
Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.
Most of the adjustments we make to our products are based on feedback from our customers, so they are valuable to us.
We pass your message on to our designers so that they can take them into consideration in the development of our future products.
Thank you.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's perfect for my needs, especially the slim size. Perfect for my backpack.
review.name: It's perfect for my needs,

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased 2 so we could try them out. Now we are coming back to purchase a full set. Love the insulation value of the double skin and how easy they are to clean
review.name: Easy to clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Honestly we are using them for toddler plates to avoid plastic. It's going great and we can bring them camping.
review.name: Toddler plates

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These plates are very nice in material, color and weight. Stackable too. Can’t wait to use them in our teardrop camper!
review.name: Colorful camp plate

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have an additional three camp plates, with this one will be four, my family likes them a lot, we put hot food on them and it doesn't burn your hands when you get them from the bottom, getting two more.
review.name: Great camping plates.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Finding equipment that can withstand the outdoors can be difficult, but these plates are amazing! They're lightweight and sturdy enough to throw in the backpack for the trail, and stack easily for storage. The stainless steel top makes it easy to clean, while the bottom plastic prevents your hands from getting burned by hot food items on the plate. Highly Recommend.
review.name: Best Camping Plate!

review.reviewBody: The outdoor kitchenware does not disappoint. We've been on a few camping trips so far and they've stood up really well. Very durable, and also have a nice weight that's sturdy enough to enjoy a meal around the campfire. Being able to throw them in the dishwasher when we get home is a nice bonus too. The coating holds up nicely. I don't see ever having to replace these. Highly recommend!
review.name: Amazing quality!

review.reviewBody: The bottom layer is plastic. I figured they were coated stainless steel like the water bottles. Not the case. A bit disappointing. Other than that they seem pretty good for the price.
review.name: Bottom layer is plastic

name: Camp Plate

review.reviewBody: I've had these for about 11 months. I don't wear them every run but probably have over 500 miles in them. The shoe and tread is still in great shape (I usually tear through uppers very quickly). I don't feel super fast in them, but they have enough cushion to keep me comfy on longer runs. I prefer the Bushido 2's on trails, but on runs longer than 10 miles my knees feel destroyed with those, these shoes don't have that problem.
review.name: Long lasting

review.reviewBody: It killed my Achilles.  I don't think I'm the only one too.  These shoes seem like a rare miss but an otherwise excellent brand.
review.name: Mostly good, but the heel is tall and super stiff

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love this shoe, and I think I could have but for one thing. The heel counter destroys my achilles. Just a few miles and the skin at the top of the heel was ripped raw. :( Just about every other aspect I think is good but I cannot run long enough in them to find out. Considering taking a knife/scissors to them.
review.name: So disappointed :(

review.reviewBody:
This is my first pair of LS shoes, so I don't have any other models to compare them to, but they are amazing. The cushion, protection, and stability are the best I've ever had, especially considering how lightweight they are. I have a semi-wide foot and had to go up a full size, but I'm sooo glad I did. They are super comfortable in all the terrain I run.

Note: The Achilles blister issue is real. Luckily, I was properly warned when I bought them and taped up before my first couple 5 mile break in runs. Once I got them broken in, it's a non-issue.
review.name: Size Up and Run Hard

review.reviewBody:
I bought these shoes knowing about the finicky fitment around the achilles, but after mostly loving the Kaptiva I figured it was worth a try.  
They fit my feet exelent, super comfortable and stable for me. However, the outsole on both shoes is already chunking (big pieces falling off) and falling apart after just a couple of trips into the mountains.  Cheap adhesives and weak, not very grippy rubber.  It's a huge bummer because they would be awesome shoes if it wasn't for this oversight. I couldn't possibly imagine doing a mtn ultra in these shoes without completely destroying them in one go.
review.name: Not up to par with with La Sportivas typic quality

review.reviewBody: I figured I should add my voice to the chorus: my first pair of these were ok, with some slight rubbing on the achilles tendon / back of foot area. The second pair, the pain was unbearable my first run. I tried wearing thicker socks, and even then, a short 3 mile run would cause such rubbing that I would be in pain. Something having to do with the plastic fin in the back of the shoe rubbing up against my achilles tendon. After 19 miles I gave up on these and bought other shoes.
review.name: Same back-of-foot blister issues

review.reviewBody: These are mostly comfortable to run in, especially over significant distances. But I've found that for some reason I'm more prone to rolling my ankles wearing these compared to the Kaptiva, Lycan, Wildcat, or Helios. I thought it was just me, but a (female) friend has found the same thing. On a long run last summer, I was feeling great in these on a rocky trail, then caught a pretty small rock just wrong and got a grade 2 AITFL sprain that kept me from running for 7 weeks. Even fully recovered, I've found the same thing is still true and it makes me way more cautious and slower on trails.
review.name: Comfortable but not stable

review.reviewBody: I've owned two pairs, and as much as I wanted to like these shoes unfortunately I cannot.  The first pair gave me blisters on the heel and arch.  I thought maybe it was because I was so used to running in Bushido's and these were just a different fit.  My feet became used to the feel and now onto the second pair:  even worse.  The heel cup has some sort of hard plastic piece that just digs straight in.  Eight years of ultra training and I've never had a blister on top of a blister.  Please fix that painful plastic heel cup!
review.name: Blisters!

review.reviewBody:
This shoe was close to being good. Good sole, traction, feels like a serious trail running shoe for rough terrain, however a couple issues:

1. The achilles cup design - it comes to a point and somewhat points into into your heel instead of being a kind of u shape that cups your achilles, very odd. I spent time working this part of the shoes before wearing so that it would flex more and this helped however it wasn't very comfortable especially when the fore foot is extended forwards. 
2. Uppers - The deal breaker for me was that they were extremely unsecure when going downhill. No matter how tight i tied the laces my feet would still slide forward even though the fit of the shoe was right. The laces are thin like most La Sportivas however combine with an unusually thin tounge you will feel the laces cut into the top of your foot if you tie them tight enough to secure your feet. I just couldn't get them secure enough that i had to run painfully slow/cautiously downhill as my feel would frequently slide forward.

Like many others i've also resorted to buying overpriced Akasha's from Europe on ebay since that's the only place you can get them. La Sportiva just needs to start selling Akasha's in the US again, it's a perfect trail shoe!
review.name: Jackal is a miss, bring back the Akasha!

review.reviewBody: Well, I really wanted to like this shoe. La Sportiva has always been too narrow through the toe box for me and this one finally fit the bill! That was until I started running. Within 10 minutes I could feel my Achilles’ tendon being rubbed and I knew I was in for blisters. Within 30 minutes I had to stop. Disappointed as I thought this was the shoe. I actually don’t remember the last time I had a blister and I put in a lot of miles. Too bad.
review.name: Achilles Blister

review.reviewBody: Got this CotoPaxi bag for an upcoming series of out and pack hiking/biking trips and it’s been the perfect companion. Can fit a ton of gear in here and still it’s not too heavy.
review.name: Premier gear for any adventure

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for. Good for travel, work, and it's water-resistant.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody: I should have got more color. I will buy another one.
review.name: I should have got more

review.reviewBody: Great backpack! I shopped around a lot for daily use/ hiking/ travel backpack and bought and returned several other brands. The Mente 32L is perfect for daily use and travel. The laptop sleeve is excellent for a 14" wide laptop and would hold one slightly larger just fine. It had a good variety of pockets for organization but doesn't overdo the options. Highly recommend this bag. Especially when on sale, this can't be beat.
review.name: Excellent daily use bag

review.reviewBody: The pack is large enough to carry what my daughter needs while on the trail or in Basecamp. Still small enough to be practical.
review.name: Mente 32L Day Pack

review.reviewBody: It is my first time to buy a Cotopaxi bag, i heard about it so long, but hesitate it. Until i review the life time warranty and the beautiful colors set. With the black Friday sale, i bought 3 backpacks and i got all of them. So pretty of the color and structure, good size each of them and exceed my expectation. Thanks
review.name: Great Product with good color, components, structure.

review.reviewBody:
I've used this backpack once so far on a trip and it was amazing. There is a place for everything & as a Type A personality that goes a long way! 
I travel with the typical items, an extra set of clothing (if I check my bag), my medication (bc you should never put them in a checked bag), some extra toiletries (in case of flight delays), a comfy shoe change option (bc who wants to be forced to wear uncomfy shoes all day), my Pixel pad & full size headphones (really drowns out the screams of hungry & sleepy children), a couple of not so healthy snacks for when I get hangry, & finally a book. 
I was able to fit all of that in this bag, still have room, & it didn't feel like I was carrying around a load of bricks. 
Everything was easily accessible & it was comfortable to carry. Really ticked all the boxes for me when it comes to a good backpack. Worth the price for sure.
review.name: The Perfect Backpack for me.

review.reviewBody: Got this for travel and it did not disappoint on my recent trip!
review.name: Got this for travel and

review.reviewBody:
Great pack for any occasion whether you’re using it for travel or getting out for a long hike. The pack has many compartments for storage and fits to size and is comfortable. Its lightweight and appears to be built for
durability.
review.name: Mente Day Pack - 32L

review.reviewBody: This is a great backpack, fits my laptop, camera and all my other stuff with plenty of room, along with being really durable for anything I do.
review.name: Great backpack

name: Mente Cada Dia 32L Daypack
