review.reviewBody: I really like this vest. It's very cute, super soft and very warm. I just went for a 45 min walk in 35 degree weather with this and just an under base layer. The only feature I wish it had was a zipper. Just a button up is kind of annoying to put on and off.
review.name: Wish it had a zipper

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size and I have found it can be reversed! It’s perfect for chilly days where you just need that extra layer.
review.name: Awesome vest!

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for something cozy to wear when walking my dogs on the beach in the morning/evening. I tried on the bivy jacket and  loved it!,  but living in Southern California I really had no need to spend that much money for a jacket I would rarely be able to wear. This vest was just perfect for what I needed. I got the navy/army green vest on sale! It goes with most of my causal wardrobe and hiking gear. I love that I can throw this on over a long sleeved shirt , sweater or sweatshirt.  I really enjoy the hood and it does a great job blocking the wind which helps keep my warm without having to wear a beanie.  I intended on ordering a small but accidentally ordered an xs but it fits be perfectly, with enough room for light layering. 
Yes it does attract dog hair, but that?s already a major part of my life LOL.
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: I eyed this vest for a long time before being ready to spend the money on it, but finally bought it in sage khaki. I have an obsession with vests because I dislike wearing bulky coats, and in Arkansas there's a good portion of the winter where a vest is sufficient if you aren't outside for extended periods of time. When I first tried it on, I wasn't sure if it would keep me as warm as my Patagonia Down Sweater Vest, and admittedly it's not the same fill level - but it's still significantly warmer than I expected! I also was hesitant about having a hood, but I really like it. I ordered the same size as my Patagonia Down Sweater Vest, and while it is maybe a little tighter across my chest, I wouldn't want to go up a size. I wore it on a slightly rainy day and was impressed with the fabric's resistance to water. My only complaint is that the canvas material tends to hold hair and fuzz, so I have to lint roller it before and after I wear it. If I am wearing a dark-colored long sleeve or flannel, I will notice that color of fuzz on the vest. Worth it, though, because the vest is unique and comfy!
review.name: Unique and warm!

review.reviewBody:
I ended up returning this item because I didn't need it (admittedly a stress-purchase!).  BUT it was really lovely.  The fabric on the outside was tough enough to withstand some daily wear, but still soft.  The inside lining was silky and comfy.  Just what I would expect from Patagonia.  
The Small was a bit snug (I'm 5'4" 130lbs with a small bust), so if I were to keep it, I'd probably want a Medium.
review.name: Nice Quality

review.reviewBody: Quality vest - it fits me well (over a light sweatshirt) and is so warm (good for chilly days here in Minnesota). I'm especially excited about the cozy pockets for my hands (there is a nice little zipper pocket inside too). I am also a fan of the hood on it. Vests have never really been my thing, so I hesitated for a long time with this purchase (seriously about 2 years). I am really happy with my purchase and expect to make good use of it.
review.name: So warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: Bought these for regular mtb and road riding with flat pedals. The sole is very grippy and work great!
review.name: Very comfortable!

review.reviewBody: This shoe is a full 1/2" shorter then the Specialized chart indicates. I might be able to use it except it is also insanely narrow for some reason. Unless you have little rocket feet stay away from this product without being able to try it on first. It is also not returnable as it clearly states "All Final Sales" on my receipt.
review.name: Not True to Size.

review.reviewBody: Made my endurance runs more comfortable and increased my speed. Rubber compound a little soft and damaged on first ride by Race Face Ride 100% plastic pedals.
review.name: Flat Pedal Shoe

review.reviewBody: Comfortable for riding only, not to walk around, hardcore solid shoes, exactly what I was looking for, been riding for a month and loving it.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: They run over a size small. I'd return them but Backcountry wants to charge me. Epic fail of a purchase - a product I can't use and a store that's charging for a return.
review.name: Run really small

review.reviewBody: Been using the FiveTen Freeriders for a while now and decided I wanted to change it up a bit and see what else was out there.  These were on a pretty big deal so I pulled the trigger.  The bottom sole is so rigid you can’t bend them at all except for near the toe.  Literally no foot fatigue whatsoever which was a problem I had frequently with the Freeriders.  They say there’s some special sole technology that helps pedaling efficiency but I haven’t really seen that at all.  They’re comfortable, they grip like glue, and they look great.  Very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Wish I would’ve bought these sooner.

review.reviewBody: Great support on soles , climbing up hills much nicer than wearing tennis shoes
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: Best
review.name: Goooooooooood

review.reviewBody: Good shoe for biking.  My song loves these for all his DJ and MTB rides
review.name: Great MTB shoe

review.reviewBody: Best Low Top Flat Out There! Stiff sole, comfy upper and insole. Stick well to the pedals and seem to last plenty long. 2nd pair I’ve bought in the past 2-3 years because I can’t pass up a great sale, thanks BC
review.name: 2 Thumbs Up for 2FO!

review.reviewBody: It’s totally royal blue. Perfectly serviceable gear sling.
review.name: Wish it was actually purple!

review.reviewBody: My daughter “stole” my rack and almost all my gear, and with it my pink padded gear sling from the bygone 80’s, punk, and Lycra days. Prefer trad pieces on a sling so I can move it around and scrum my hips in chimneys, corners, and wide cracks. This sling is just like the old one, highly adjustable, padded, and comfy. Though I’d gladly trade the purple padded for my trusty old pink.
review.name: Old school

review.reviewBody: Wow, you would think there is only so much you could say about a nylon runner sewn to a piece of foam but let me tell you BD has totally hit it out of the park with this one. 2023 is the year we bring back the padded sling, so beat the hype and get that gear off your harness before your friends. Only downside, picture shows a pretty dope purple but mine came blue… still neat!
review.name: What a sling

review.reviewBody: A great way to organize and store gear. Much better than stuffing everything in a bag at the end of a climb
I ordered this hoping I would get the purple gear sling in the picture, but when I open the box it was blue!
review.name: It’s actually blue!!!

review.reviewBody: Great sling. Super Comfortable and holds everything I need. Thanks for the quality product BD!!
review.name: Solid Sling

review.reviewBody: Great for carying your rack (double rack in my case). I also like to carry it on route for the follower to pick-up gear. Must item in my opinion.
review.name: One of a kind!

review.reviewBody: Definitely a must if you're always hauling even a small trad rack. It helps to keep it organized getting it in or out of your backpack, and certainly makes it way more comfortable when sorting gear at the bottom of a route or re-racking at the end of a long day at the crag. Has enough space for a double rack of cams up to #4 a set of stoppers and a good count of quickdraws and alpine slings.
review.name: Built for the long haul

review.reviewBody: Well I thought I was ordering purple, I guess blue is cool... haven’t used it yet but seems like a good gear sling!
review.name: Not purple

review.reviewBody: Good adjustable gear sling that distributes the weight with the wide padded shoulder strap.

review.reviewBody: This shirt has essentially failed after only a six mile ruck march.  At first I loved this shirt, very comfortable, lots of excellent stretch, very good softshell water resistance as well - but durable, it is not.  It is described as durable, including abrasion resistant and suitable for climbing harness wear/tear, and materials feel like they will be.  But, first time out showed this to be far from true.   I did a fast hike/run with a backpack weighing about 35lbs.  Got back and put the shirt in for a gentle wash per label, and when it came out and dried, very bad piling was evident in each place where my rucksack was apparently rubbing including the back and shoulders where the shoulder straps covered.   This shirt would have been my favorite go to for excellent temperature and moisture regulation, excellent comfort and stretch, excellent looks, etc. But the lack of durability is very frustrating and disappointing.  My new shirt now looks horrible after only one use in the wilderness.
review.name: Wanted to love this technical shirt really bad

review.reviewBody: I switched to flat pedals on my mountain bike and bought these shoes at the same time as the pedals because I wasn't going to make the switch unless I found flat pedal shoes that fit my picky feet. Took my first ride yesterday and I was not disappointed. First off, the flat pedals were a gamechanger, and I'm sure a lot of the reason for that was I loved these shoes as well. I wear an 8.5, which is what I ordered, and I would say they are slightly longer than my other 8.5 shoes but not noticeably so when I'm riding. I have a pretty narrow foot and was able to adjust the laces to achieve the perfect fit. The toe box is pretty roomy (especially relative to my road shoes) which I preferred as the shoes are very breathable and I could wiggle my toes when my feet started feeling numb. I was worried the excess material on top would not be comfortable when I hiked up steep or rocky sections, but was very happy with how well they performed when I did that a few times during the ride, plus they felt more like good hiking shoes compared to more snuggly fitting shoes with cleats on the bottom.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoe! They felt very stiff and tight at first but broke in really fast. I normally wear size 8 1/2 shoe, but for some reason the 8 in this style fits the best.
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shoes fits great, is very durable, waterproof and has loads of grip. Being a pro dh racer that also likes to take her feet off the pedals off jumps, this shoe is perfect for me. I hope to have Adidas Five Ten join my list of sponsors, in the future.
review.name: Top of the line!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and grippy. Keep my feet in the right place.
review.name: I love my grippy mtb shoes.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Provides great support and stability when mountain biking!
review.name: So worth it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ordered 9.5 size and it was spot on with my usually shoe size.
review.name: Awesome and sturdy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Much better than the non-PRO versions, super sticky, comfortable walking around in them too
review.name: Super comfortable, green for flat pedaling

review.reviewBody: Good shoes, comfy, price reasonable, happy with products
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and durable a must have for mountain biking!
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoes stick to the pedals, the only issue I have is the shoes run small, size up.
review.name: Great purchase.

review.reviewBody: Bought a size 2- I’m 5’1”,110 lbs and they feel too big. Material is nice
review.name: Run large

review.reviewBody: The waist is a tiny bit loose but overall I love these shorts!
review.name: Super comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts but expected them to be a little thicker. They'll still work for a bike ride and hot say or, bike ride on a hot day.
review.name: Love the color and length

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I held off on buying these because they seem kinda long but wow, they are just so great for biking and also for casual wear. I bought a second pair immediately. I love the weight - not too hot. I love the fact that they don't ride up when biking. I always have my iPhone in the side pocket and it is easy to zip and unzip for photo time. The fit is great and like the extra elastic to get them to stretch enough over my belly! My bike liners fit easily underneath. They work great for hiking as well. I love them! Love the light colors too - I got gray and that dusty pink. I am wearing the Astroman blouse in the photo fyi. Another new love.
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very happy with my purchase of these comfortable shorts. They looked so nice my friend order a pair for herself.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wore these on the Oregon Outback and they were great over bike shorts. Fits true to size, big pockets, and a perfect zippered side pocket so your phone doesn't get in the way when biking. Fabric is super light and breathable with just enough stretch to feel secure yet allow free movement while pedaling
review.name: Love these for biking

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Comfortable, lightweight, breathable and washes and dries with ease.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the color, fit, and functionality. Phone can sit in side pocket without jiggling, shorts dry quickly and have perfect stretch.
review.name: Great Fit and Function.

review.reviewBody: I ordered the size 6 at first and tried to wear it but they were just too big. I returned (and Backcountry took my return even though I wore once) and exchanged for a size 4. They fit, but still are roomy. I love the material and fit though. A size 2 might fit, but be a bit tight, but there is no way I should even be able to fit into a size 2 ever. Be sure to size down.
review.name: Runs very big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] love my ferrosi 12" shorts! everyday shorts for running errands, biking, day hikes and walking the neighborhood. comfortable and good quality like all outdoor research items.
review.name: everyday shorts

name: Ferrosi 12in Over Short - Women's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this bag! My goal was to find the smallest, most low-profile backpack for my 13” laptop and the Arcane small is the best I’ve found. In fact, I loved it so much I bought it in a 2nd color! The interior organizational pockets are perfect for holding smaller items, and it comfortably fits a water bottle and rain jacket with room to spare. 

My only complaints are the stretchy pocket on the strap seems too small to be functional (what are y’all putting in there??) and I wish the front zipper were on the opposite side (just a personal preference).
review.name: I love this bag! My

Since I’m never without a water bottle and a book, I use it daily more as a purse and it’s a great size, with just enough compartments to be helpful without having too many small places to lose track of things. The straps are very comfortable and it has managed rainy camping and hiking adventures while keeping my things dry.

review.itemreviewed: Road Comp BOA Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My old shoes were suppose to be size 10 but always fit tight and after further investigation noted that they were a size 43 which is 9 1/2 at best.  My Scott shoes are a size 44 and fit great.  Should have switched long ago.  The fit is great and priced right.
review.name: great fit

review.itemreviewed: Road Comp BOA Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm not a serious racer and maybe only put in about 2 rides a week. So when it came time to replace my old Shimano SH-R191L (carbon sole started to separate at the heel) I started looking for a decent shoe with the BOA retention system and not to pricey. Having a carbon sole was not a concern. At about $100, this Scott shoe fits the bill. The fit is true with a roomy toe box and the BOA retention system is perfect.
review.name: Great value in a budget road shoe!

name: Road Comp BOA Cycling Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Coleman Morph CVT Soft Cooler 24-Can online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Morph CVT Soft Cooler 24-Can
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Morph CVT Soft Cooler 24-Can online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Not well made.  The seams ripped on second use and only 1/4 full
review.name: Not a great cooler for the $$
comment:
Hello! We regret that your soft cooler is seams ripped. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. Furthermore, we will make sure that your thoughts are shared because we value and truly appreciate your feedback.

If you have any additional queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: This for a small space in our side by side.  The second time we used it the zipper broke.  Very disappointed because it was just the size we looking for.
review.name: Bad zipper
comment:
Hello! We’re also disappointed that the zipper of your soft cooler is broken. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. Your feedback is highly appreciated and valued by the business, and we will make sure that your insights are shared.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wanted something more compact cooler wise for carrying to and from work.  Fits 24 cans nicely but wanted it for bigger size wattle bottle for work.  Fits 8-10 tall water bottles nicely, definitely what I needed for work.  Love the book bag style as it isn't to bulky.  Only draw back is I don't feel it keeps things cool unless you add ice to that particular cooler.  Adding ice to my water bottles still didn't keep my drinks cold as I would have liked, so only draw back on cooler.  Other than that I use it everyday still for work
review.name: Book bag style cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is our new favorite take just about everywhere cooler!  It has pockets, pockets everywhere!  It is a soft durable water resistant fabric, is lined on the inside and deep!  The best part you can carry it over your shoulder with a strap or in converts into a BACKPACK!  We've used it for the lake, hiking, road adventures and even bring your own family picnics! Coleman has done it with the versatility with this one!
review.name: New Favorite Cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cooler is great to have around so that you can place all your favorite drinks. You can fit up to 4 6-packs or use it to store a 6-pack and your favorite dishes. The cooler maintains its contents cool for almost 24 hours or more. Get yours today!
review.name: Nice cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was used for a guided fishing excursion and it was very beneficial! My boys were able to carry it on their back and had their hands free to carry their fishing supplies. It kept waters and protein drinks cold all day. It has lots of pockets and they were able to put lots of snacks in there as well. It's a great soft cooler!
review.name: Durable and beneficial!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this  Coleman - MRPH CVTBL SOFT COOLER 24CAN MOSS C002 to try! I took it to the zoo and the beach! This is a must, I love that you can use it as a back pack or carry it over the shoulder. Its soft and nice. I love that it can fit 24 cans.
review.name: very durable and light weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this cooler primarily for water In the summers here its shape makes it difficult to place anywhere and not have it turn over on you though but it does hold ice all day long. my only complaint would be the shape
review.name: good for drinks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love that this can be used as a backpack.  It also has pockets all the way around for other items.  The zipper at the top is a little odd so you can't fit anything large inside,  it's best for a bunch of small items.
review.name: Backpack cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] i love this soft ice chest! it is so durable. stands up on its own, has 3 different ways you can carry it. fits a ton of stuff on the inside. has 2 large packets on the outside where i was able to fit 2 1 liter bottles of sparkling water.
review.name: BEST SOFT COOLER EVER

name: Morph CVT Soft Cooler 24-Can

hasVariant.name: Rekon 3C/EXO+/TR Tire - 29in
hasVariant.description: Buy the Maxxis Rekon 3C/EXO+/TR Tire - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This tire (Rekon 3C/EXO+ 29 X 2.4) weighs about 8 oz more than the Rekon Race 29 X 2.4 standard 3C/EXO tire at 954 gm (33.6 oz) I bought a second Rekon that weighs 975 gm. I installed the lighter tire on the rear after my OEM Rekon Race wore out after 870 miles. I haven't installed the other tire on the front yet. The Race tire never gripped on the loose over hardpack very well. This tire has barely slipped in those conditions. I have ridden it 300 miles in the last month and I'm very happy with the grip on the climbs and I have not had a flat or puncture. The tire's sidewall is also stiffer on this EXO+ edition. I was running 18 psi on the Rekon Race and went to 17 psi on this tire. (Too low? Gotta float like a butterfly across the rock gardens) I use this on a 120mm Orbea Oiz Full Susp XC bike. So far I have ridden the tire aggressively in the Park City area mountains, Draper and other foothill XC trails in Northern Utah. I don't ride skidders. I have ridden it across the Wasatch Crest a couple times too. It didn't rain for over 6 months so conditions have been dry and dusty. The tire was easy to install tubeless on Orbea's MP 30 carbon rims. I do not use inserts. The tire seems to be wearing really well, so far, comparing the tread to the new Rekon I haven't installed yet. I'll buy the tire again.
review.name: I like it

review.reviewBody: My new go to tire for weight, durability and drip.  Used on a hard tail Specialized with a tubeless setup.  Its an excellent all around option for  Northern Utah.
review.name: Love This Tire

name: Rekon 3C/EXO+/TR Tire - 29in

comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Perfect light weight rain jacket. Just bought my second one to keep on the boat. Perfect for warm weather in SF.
review.name: Lightest weight rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought this on sale , I’m a XL it arrived but the fit is more like a large, can’t return it because of sale price and can’t return because all sales are final. Stuck with a very expensive jacket that doesn’t fit.
review.name: Small fit...

review.reviewBody: Great windbreaker rain protection So lightweight it’s not a hindrance to casting at sll
review.name: Super lightweight perfect for south Florida winter fishing

review.reviewBody: The color and style are very nice. The fabric was very thin and could easily be rolled up in a backpack.
review.name: Appealing color

review.reviewBody: This jacket is very soft and comfy, not your typical windbreaker that flaps in the wind and the sound drives you crazy all day! I was surprised how thin it was and it completely blocks the wind. This is a must have for windy cool days! Awesome product would highly recommend
review.name: Great packable jacket!

review.reviewBody: Bought it as a super light6weight and packable jacket for a Costa Rica trip. It is super lightweight and packable. Perfect for warm weather. That being said, it was completely soaked through the first rain that it saw. It was nota torrential downpour either. Not sure what DWR was used, but it probably could have used more that a single treatment. Not cool since getting anything like nikwax or revivex down here is almost impossible.
review.name: Super lightweight and packable. Not very water resistant.

review.reviewBody: The quality seems great, this jacket is thinner than I expected, it is truly a windbreaker. He has not used it yet, as this is a Christmas present, it will be good for rainy summers on the boat..
review.name: Thinner than expected

review.reviewBody: A little too light weight...worried about wearing in rain
review.name: Headwind Jacket

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight early morning, jacket for cool mornings fishing riding in the boat boat. Waited till this jacket got on sale. It is a lightweight jacket, not thick at all. Some people reviewed it negatively, but it’s exactly as described a thin lightweight jacket for wind. Definitely get it on sale. Hand pockets would be nice but again it’s just for cool mornings. Not something I would wear all day unless it’s super windy as I live in Florida.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought several of these as presents because I own one and can’t say enough good things about it!
review.name: A Christmas present

name: Headwind Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the XL after having 2 kids because even if I could still get in my L from 8 years ago it  was a little too snug around my hips. Very pleased with the fit and wow did I miss having the right gear for outside activities for the last couple years! Even if it’s advertised for ski, I wear it for walking in the rain, skating or just any fall-winter-spring activity that doesn’t require wearing a backpack. I’m 5’10” and I love how this brand is always on the longer sleeves and body.
review.name: Great 3 seasons shell

review.reviewBody: The fabric has a good quality, but the zipper is finicky and gets stuck all the time below the neck. I usually wear medium, but this model is way too big and becomes very wide under the hips, which gives a weird look. The flaps on the pockets are annoying and it would have been good to have regular pockets as well and each side as opposed to front pockets only. Overall good Gore-Tex for the price if you buy it on sale like I did. I would recommend trying it in a store to see how it fits before ordering online. The fit is not standard.
review.name: Too big and zipper is finicky

review.reviewBody: The zipper was a struggle, especially when the 2 way zipper was engaged.  Should not have this type of problem at this price.
review.name: Poor zipper quality

review.reviewBody: The fabric quality &  color was great, but this jack is made for a more hourglass figure. I am an athletic build at 5'8" 140 lbs and the jacket felt much to wide at the hips where it flared out. I was disappointed as this was one of the few I tried that the chest and shoulder fits while still having long enough sleeves.  Otherwise it would have been a perfect backcountry shell with all the features I was looking for.
review.name: Better for hourglass figure wider hips

review.reviewBody: The solid shell will definitely keep the snow and rain out. But, it’s too rigid for me. Even without an insulating layer on under it, the movement of my arms was too restricted. The sleeves were also about 2-3 inches too long (5’4”: Med) which bunched up even more of the stiff fabric.
review.name: Solid weather protection; too stiff

review.reviewBody: Bought this for Kilimanjaro; was the only one of 15 of us that didn’t get soaked through. Kept me happy and dry after 3 days of nonstop rain and snow. This is my second MH goretex and I can’t go back ☺️
review.name: Kept me Dry on Kili

review.reviewBody: Sized well with room for layers! Heading to Ireland
review.name: Gorgeous colour and plenty of pockets

review.reviewBody: Tested it out cross-country skiing in some snow and rain around Lassen.  Stayed totally dry without overheating on the uphill and kept warm on the way back down.  Love the boxy cut!  I'm usually XS-S and went with a S to leave extra room for layers.  Pretty darn light, not too crunchy, all the pockets are nice, top of the collar is soft against the chin, I like the length of the sleeves/torso, and the color is gorgeous in person.  Overall I definitely recommend this shell and I can't wait to take it out on more adventures!
review.name: Great shell for high-activity in stormy weather

review.reviewBody: I typically order a bigger size for layer but after readying the reviews I ordered a small instead of a medium.  It was still huge I should have ordered and XS.  I felt like I was swimming in it.  It's also super long which would be good for ski pants but I wear a bib so it was too much.  5'5 125 a true 4 typically wear a small and size up to a medium for extra layers.  Needed an xs
review.name: Huge

review.reviewBody:
So I got this because I saw a 1 star review saying the sleeves are for people with freakish long arms. I was sold, I have freak arms!

And yeah it's worked well for me. I've toured in it, resort skied, and used it for paragliding. Keeps water & wind out really well. Fit's my tall butt really well witch is rare for most brands. Only down side I would say is it's a bit pricey for what you get but that is almost everything right now so I don't hold it against it.
review.name: Fit's my freak arms!

name: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Guide 34+8L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Guide 34+8L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have a pack with this material weight already and its good for snow for light hiking, else I might have kept it.  Compression straps are thin and somehow a little wonky.  Shoulder straps are very flimsy and the bottom is not sturdy enough for what I intended to use this for.  I needed a pack for alpine rock and 3rd classing about.  I know that Deuter makes nice packs, I see them in the mountains all the time.  A friend has an older "guide model" about 5 years old and the thing is well built for mixed mountain travel.  This one is too light weight for my needs so I sent it back tags still attached after loading my kit and hefting it around with 18 Lbs. of my normal gear and a few layers in it.
review.name: Needed a Beefier Build

name: Guide 34+8L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
I like the look and feel of these shorts but there are 2 issues:

1. Even after tightening the webbing belt, it will eventually become loose and you would need to cinch it again.

2.  The webbing belt can become twisted within the belt loops and you would need to untwist to keep it flat and allow proper orientation to lock the clasp.

3.  The rubberized logo will come off after several washes.

Overall I would not recommend these shorts.
review.name: Good shorts but....

name: Unlimited Trail Baggy Short - Men's

description: Buy the Ignik Outdoors Gas Growler Deluxe online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Gas Growler Deluxe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ignik Outdoors Gas Growler Deluxe online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I always use the 1lb or the smaller tank until I found out about this 5 lbs Ignik Propane Tank, and also refillable.
I love that this product will save and make earth cleaner, and for me that is the most important thing to do
review.name: Ignik Tank

review.reviewBody: Just received my Gas Growler "Deluxe" today after placing order only a few days ago. Back Country sent the day I ordered and with the additional outer box, everything was in good condition. Now thats ciustomer service! I look forward to using my tank on some upcoming car camping trips and am confident I won't worry about runnning out of fuel.
review.name: Really quality kit

review.reviewBody:
I am VERY impressed with Backcountry, first of all. I ordered this two days ago and received it today. I was still waiting for the same product from another co and cancelled that order and bought a second from Backcountry. This is intended for use with a Joolca Nomad Hottap system (also awesome product).

The carrying case for the Ignik is very well made, with a molded interior and comes with the hose. The manual is simple but thorough. The strap is strong webbing with a reinforced hand grip. The zipper is smooth. I am still waiting on the Joolca, but this is perfect. I find the cost quite reasonable for a tank that is small enough to carry and can be refilled. It pays for itself in very short time.

In addition to camping, this will be used in conjunction with the Joolca Hottap during extended power outages, as my hot water heater is electric and my solar is grid-tied except for a separate solar charged backup power station system that cannot run the hot water heater.
review.name: Convenient and stylish way to transport

review.reviewBody: I've used it a couple of times already and it works great. Super easy to hook up to my Camp chef Rainier. It cost about $3.50 to fill up and that should last most of the summer. The carry case is great and keeps everything together neatly.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody:
This is no different than the typical 5 lb or 10 lb propane tanks you can buy at any local hardware store.  Plus they have different sizes from which to choose (tall and skinny to short and fat). Perhaps this has an extra ?carrying case jacket? but there?s no need, since the typical tanks have side carrying handles.   Why would you even want the case. I purchased my 5 lb tank for around $50 and it has quality brass hardware connections and hose length of my choice, made by a reputable propane company. 

I don?t understand what makes this three times more expensive than a typical 5 gal tank. Must be the marketing and the impractical but colorful carrying case.  Just pass on this and spend your money more wisely. Nothing novel to see here.
review.name: This is nothing new and is pricey

name: Gas Growler Deluxe

review.name: I bought this for an

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was hoping for more of a large towel than a small blanket. But I did get what I paid for.
review.name: It’s a blanket alright

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it. Can't wait to use next month when I go to my family reunion picnic
review.name: Festival Blanket

review.reviewBody:
I got the blanket for picnicking and festival use when I am trying to travel light.

I needed a ground blanket/picnic blanket for traveling to Europe. 

The festival blanket is a fraction of the size of our other picnic blankets, there is no way I would take this either ones to Europe with us, this festival blanket is a great size and just thick enough to do what I wanted it to do. 

I don't know if any of you have ever partied, or picnicked along the Seine in Paris?  It is so much fun on a Friday, or Saturday evening.  What is gross about it?  There are no restrooms along the river bank and you have no idea where someone has relived themself, once you see where they have, you get why you don't want to just sit anywhere and then not be sitting on something.  This blanket is easy to wash and dry.   Even being in the Alps, it is just a nice blanket to throw down to relax.  

Would I recommend this blanket?  Yes.   I think it fits a niche that most blankets don't. It isn't the best picnic blanket or the best festival blanket, but when you look at how compact it is, it just gives you so much more freedom to travel and have something instead of nothing.
review.name: Very nice picnic blanket.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thing is so well made. Perfect for camping, picnics, or just throwing in the car to keep as a party blanket.
review.name: Perfect blanket for everything

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not good for the beach. Which it was bigger. Didn’t hold its shape. Crumpled up
review.name: Ok

hasVariant.name: Ultralight Black Hole 8L Sling Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Ultralight Black Hole 8L Sling Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my new to-go carry on bag. I like the volume of it and that it has a packable pocket built in. When I'm at my destination I can use it to carry a bottle of water and some day stuff. It has a nice front pocket for my phone. It is packable, big but small.
review.name: Packable Travel Bag

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight bag. Good for day hikes, or for just traveling around. Like all my other blackhole bags... lots of zip pockets and plenty of room. Great for lightweight traveling especially when paired with the lightweight convertible backpack/tote. Only negative is that the mesh pocket needs a snap, button,  zipper or clinch pull to keep items secure when you are sliding it from front to back.
review.name: Great lightweight small bag

review.reviewBody:
@ 6.7 ounces this thing is pretty rad.. 

I have used it for my fly-fishing satchel while backpacking, it's half the weight of anything out there..  I can bring a 32oz Nalgene and my 2L Platypus water filter in the large pocket, has a phone pocket and a couple other straps you can suspend some tools from.   I have also used this while traveling, it has a good amount of space / compartments you can hold all the daily essentials from you wallet, keys, glasses, weed whatever you need on hand this can hold it..

6.7Ounces!!!! the only thing that would make this bag better would be if it was constructed with Dyneema Fabric..   I would say for the price this thing is 5 stars


Feels
review.name: Better then a backpack?

review.reviewBody: I love this sling over bag. It is perfect for walking the dog, small hikes or running errands.
review.name: Light weight and practical

name: Ultralight Black Hole 8L Sling Bag

review.reviewBody: These shorts are incredible! They run true to size. I ordered size small and medium and the medium were loose and almost saggy. I wasn’t sure about the zipper pockets and how they would lay or if they would stick out but after washing it lays perfectly and go unnoticeable- honestly these are going to be my go to short this summer. I might buy some black ones to even sleep in they are that cozy! The other review complained about the liner but if the short didn’t have one then you could see through it on lighter color fabric- view the 2024 colorways. The liner fabric is wonderful almost like a bathing suit not that weird mesh that’s in some running shorts, and soft making this a great river short even though I purchased this for hiking and camping. I have the green color and the liner is brown if that matters to you.
review.name: Buy these in every color!

review.reviewBody:
I would have loved this short, except there is a built-in underwear liner that isn’t mentioned at all in the product details. As a hiking short, I hate having the liner and makes it uncomfortable for backpacking trips. Too expensive of a short to cut it up however. The liner also makes the short fit weird, you can’t place it appropriately on your body how you’d like it to wear; the liner will ride up or sag. 

If it weren’t for the liner, it seems to be a nice, cute fitting short. Love the zippered pocket & lightweight material.
review.name: **UNDERWEAR LINER NOT MENTIONED**

name: Destination 3.5in Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: Been looking for a great quality fleece jacket for sometime and finally decided to purchase the Patagonia one. I have purchased Patagonia before and could not resist the brand even though they are a bit higher priced. I am not disappointed with the purchase since the jacket offers plenty of warmth even with a thinner under layer. Great for the colder months and I am glad I don't have to bulk up. Now I can travel light during winter. Looking for additional colors to purchase. True to size for my lean frame.
review.name: Great quality fleece jacket

review.reviewBody: I have 6 of these now all in different colors. They are very comfortable and fit true to size. Great for everyday wear when it's cooler and outdoor adventures
review.name: Love These!

review.reviewBody: I have several of these in different colors. Fit and quality are  great. They are comfortable and great for colder weather. Easy to clean. Durable. Patagonia is a great clothier.
review.name: Love this better sweater

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to fleece jacket to wear to the office.  So I do layer it with a normal button up dress shirt inside.   Given this,  I originally purchased medium and it was too snug fitting so I ended up with a large with was perfect.   So unless you are going to wear this as a slim fitting fleece without layering, I'd definitely recommend going one size up.
review.name: Runs slightly small

review.reviewBody: Compared to my previous purchase of this item a few years ago, this fit is much baggier. This may be because the prior one had stretchy side panels, this one does have that. Also the prior one had nice pull-on tabs on the zippers, this one does not. Somewhat disappointed.
review.name: Not so better sweater

review.reviewBody:
The "Better Sweater" is a great all around jacket.  Super warm, wears very well and is a good second layer.
I live in a mountain and wear this on any outing and is good in the causal setting
review.name: Great Fleece Sweater

review.reviewBody:
Let's talk cozy! The Patagonia Better Sweater Fleece Jacket isn't just another fleece jacket; it's a cuddle in fabric form. Seriously, the inside feels like a luxurious cloud decided to become wearable. It's perfect for those crisp mornings by the campfire, or those days where you just need to cocoon yourself in warmth.

But this bad boy isn't all about feeling like a giant teddy bear. It's got some serious style chops too. The sweater-knit face makes it look polished enough to wear around town, so you can go from conquering a mountain to grabbing coffee with friends without having to do a wardrobe change. Plus, Patagonia's quality is legendary, and this jacket is built to last. I've thrown it in the wash countless times and it still looks (and feels) amazing.
Now, let's be honest, it's not gonna win any awards for handling a monsoon. But for light rain or snow, it holds its own. Think of it like a trusty sidekick – it'll keep you comfortable most of the time, but maybe pack an umbrella for the crazy weather days.

All in all, the Patagonia Better Sweater Fleece Jacket is a winner in my book. It's comfy, stylish, and built to last – what more could you ask for in a fleece companion?
review.name: OMG this is warm

review.reviewBody: I bought this sweater to wear for work. Very comfortable! fits nicely. will order another color!
review.name: Patagonia full Zip Sweater

review.reviewBody: It is not as warm as an average lightweight fleece jacket, but it is still nice. If you are in a breeze at 50°, you might be a bit chilly unless you have a light underlayment. The arms are slightly snug for what I’m used of but it is still OK and probably more fashionable than my older jackets. The material on the exterior will snag on the leather of my console which is slightly cracked. I thought my arm was stuck in syrup until I realized it was just acting like Velcro. The crack in the leather is very slight and you cannot feel any roughness with your fingers, but the jacket still snags to it , overall I am pleased with the purchase
review.name: Not very warm

name: Better Sweater Fleece Jacket - Men's
Patagonia Men’s Better Sweater Fleece Jacket | GH Review

review.reviewBody: These Shoes First, I wear a size 10.5 to 11 in hiking boots/shoes, and skate shoes. I ordered a size 11 in these and it?s PERFECT with about 1/2 to 5/8? room for toes. I couldn?t have fit these better if I got them in store. Now, let?s talk about feel? wow, these are so dagburn comfy I haven?t taken them off (except sleep) since I received them in the mail. I?m a shoe/boot guy so I have boxes of shoes and these are more comfy than any of my skate shoes. They might be a bit hot in dead summer but for what they are the breathing works absolutely great. These Heath almost like ultralight hiking boots. The grip is Vans on double dose steroids!  They are just as good if not better on the pedal hip as 5Tens, it?s just a different sole design so hard to compare the feel. Holy crap I don?t know how they do it but I have some Stamp Pedals and I can seriously pick my bike up a bit with the grab. At any rate, BUY these sons of motherless goats before they are gone!! PERFECT winter riding shoe in Austin TX. Hope this 2Sense helps all y?all.
review.name: 5Ten/Adidas, look out!!

review.reviewBody: Fit snug but very comfy once broken in after a few rides. I like the TPU toe protection almost feels like lightweight steel toe shoes.
review.name: Comfy :)

review.reviewBody: These are the most uncomfortable boots I've ever worn. I returned this color, but kept two others and now I'm stuck with them.
review.name: Very uncomfortable!

review.reviewBody: Usually wear a women’s 8.5 wide. These fit just about right.  These are snug at the instep if you have “taller” feet; it took a few wears to start to feel comfortable, and takes a shoe horn every time to get them on. Surprisingly roomy at toe box (which is where my width is). Learher and construction seem good. Cork later at the sole makes these a bit more casual, but colorwise, plays well with all the neutrals.  Good looking for a casual boot. Squeaky for first day, then not again. Haven’t tested waterproofing yet.
review.name: Buy a shoe horn, look great

review.reviewBody: These boots fail the basic Chacos test: my feet hurt after less an hour. I have worn pretty much nothing but Chacos for over a decade, as the sandal base supports my feet, and my feet typically don’t hurt. These boots look stylish, but aren’t supportive. Just kind of meh.
review.name: Meh.
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: They didn't fit. Since they didn't fit, I returned them. I think that explanation satisfies the 50 characters required for this review.
review.name: I don't blame Chaco
comment: Thank you for your feedback.

review.reviewBody: Overall, I'm happy with the boots. My biggest complaint is that your feet don't breathe in them, which keeps them from being a 5 star product. The footbed and toe box are quite comfortable.
review.name: Great boot but not breathable

review.reviewBody: Boots looked great but were way too big. I've eorn a 7 for years, just not in this boot. Returned and refunded promptly
review.name: Too big
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback Cade.

review.reviewBody: Bought this planning to use for professional settings, had to return. Mainly because this was the squeakiest shoe I’ve ever worn. Couldn’t walk 3 steps without the sound irritating me. But even if that goes away over time, the sole of the shoe looks so strange that I couldn’t wear it in a professional setting. It’s a bummer since the shoe fit great.
review.name: Wildly squeaky, and ugly bottom layer
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: I love these. I was apprehensive at first but they are by far my favorite boots now.
review.name: Great fit and comfortable
comment: Being your favorite is our favorite! Thanks!

review.reviewBody: I am a property developer. I wanted a shoe that was comfortable, looked stylish, yet durable enough to walk around on a retail commercial property construction site. I literally wore these shoes for the very first time this week for 6 days (Monday-Saturday) 8 hours a day and they look like Ive had them for years. They are comfortable, but the crease where my toe bends cracked, and the leather really stretched. I am 5' 11" and 180 pounds. I am not some huge dude. These shoes shouldn't have worn this quickly for the price. I was literally only walking around on gravel. The sole is barely worn.
review.name: Lower Tier Craftsmanship & Durability
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable, easy to get on and off, waterproof, and handsome. I couldn’t ask for much more.
review.name: My new favorites
comment: Thanks Bob! We love being the favorite!

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing this boot daily for my walks with the dogs.  At 74 years old did not believe I would be comfortable in my walks anymore.  These boots changed my mind and the dogs, and I are delighted.
review.name: All that I wanted in a hiking boot.

review.reviewBody: I just broke in this boot on a ten day backpacking trip in Iceland.  My feet stayed blister free and dry, despite several rainy days, and the boots were super sturdy on rocky, muddy and uneven terrain.  I’ve owned several pairs of hiking boots over the years, and these are my absolute favorite.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I’ve hiked more than 10 miles in these boots. They are fantastic. Fit is true to size, no hot spots. Lots of tie room and snug in the heel. I was in water a few times and they stayed dry. My best boots ever!!  Comfortable with good support in ankle and secure in rocks and loose pebbles.
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these boots after spraining my ankle. Super support. My go to shoe.  Bought two more pairs so I can have a reserve. Old enough to know if you find a great shoe buy another pair before you need to! No
review.name: Great shoe 80 years young love them!

review.reviewBody: Needed new hiking boots. Have had several pairs of Asolo boots but was having trouble finding Asolo's at my usual hiking equipment stores. Got these from Backcountry for a GREAT price. Fit perfectly the minute I first put them on.
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: These boots are so comfortable and yet so supportive! They do not need to be broken in. From the first time I put them on I was able to hike miles in them!
review.name: Most comfortable boots ever!

description: Buy the Thule GateMate Pro Tailgate Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GateMate Pro Tailgate Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule GateMate Pro Tailgate Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GateMate Pro Tailgate Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule GateMate Pro Tailgate Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My wife and I purchased the GateMate PRO a few months ago at the same time we purchased new bikes. We have had great experience with other Thule products in the past and this seemed like a great way for us to transport our new bikes. However I find it challenging to install the GateMate. The straps are positioned so that you need to thread them from the outside upward under your truck gate. It seems like it would be way simpler to use gravity and thread them from the other way. 

The plastic buckles are located at the bottom of the inside section and I find it challenging to keep the GateMate from slipping and getting the buckles broken while trying to close the talegate.

At first I thought this was just me so I went back to the bike shop and they found this design extremely challenging. I have seen many other similar products on a recent trip out west. I am not sure they are any better but I would not purchase this particular product again.
review.name: Poor design!
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule GateMate PRO.
The buckles of this product are on the inside of of the tailgate for two reasons. This limits the overall exposure to the elements by keeping them away from direct contact with particulate that could kick up from the road, and also acts as a mild theft deterrent by keeping the access system out of direct line of sight. 
The positioning of the buckles themselves usually is dependent on the vehicle they are attached to. If there is an issue with the buckles catching in the tailgate, it is possible the incorrect size of the Thule GateMate PRO is being used.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this one mount ago and realy happy with it. 
If I take out pedal, I can install 6 ebike.
For regular bike with narrow tube frame, the velcro are a litle difficulte to fit
review.name: Good bike transporter

review.reviewBody: It took no time to set this product up. We took it on an RV trip, and it worked seamlessly. The bikes didn’t move or jostled at all being strapped in and it was easy to get them on the Thule. The product was very sturdy, and made with very good material. When not in use it folds away very easily. I only wish that the straps were able to have a little more Velcro to them.
review.name: Solid and Easy to Use

review.reviewBody: Purchased for family use and works great for carrying bikes in a smaller box to protectboth the bikes and the finish of the truck....highly recommended!
review.name: As Always, High Quality and Well Made!

review.reviewBody: Fits my GMC Sierra  multi-pro tailgate and easy to install. Used a couple times so far and keeps bikes stable and protects my tailgate.  Got the large size and fits perfect. Fits five bikes easily and could probably get two more in there.  “I like it a lot”
review.name: Works!

review.reviewBody: Very impressed with the design, fit, and function of the GateMate PRO. It took a little fiddling with it to get it to sit on the tailgate correctly (I only had one set of pad blocks over the top at first) but once I readjusted it fit my RAM 1500 perfectly.  The straps took a bit of finesse to work through the gap between the bottom of the gate and the truck bed, but that is more a function of how the truck was designed.  I plan to keep a small piece of bent coat hanger wire in one of the pockets to help me pull the straps through the gap when I install it again.  The Cannondale mountain bikes we hauled sat neatly in the cradle of the foam pads and the straps secured them incredibly well to the truck.  For all of the goofballs that complained about the length of the strap in the other reviews - All you have to do is wrap the strap around the frame tube one extra revolution THEN thread it through the plastic ring and cinch it tight.  Makes me wonder how some people manage to find their way out of bed in the morning, but I digress.  This method of one extra wrap around the frame tube provides a really nice grip on the frame.  We drove a couple of hundred miles so far with the bikes strapped down and they don't wiggle or bounce at all.  The mesh storage pockets are a nice touch, as is the cutout that provides access to the tailgate handle and backup camera.  The material that sits against the vehicle paint is incredibly soft.  Sure, there may be cheaper options out there but they certainly don't appear to be as well-made as this one.  VERY pleased with the purchase!
review.name: Nice design and well constructed!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve installed this GateMate Pro in my F150 Lightning. The gate is a couple of inches too wide to cleanly fit inside the frame of my Retrax tonneau, but because the GateMate is flexible I’m able to squeeze it in enough to close the tailgate. I might trim a bit off the sides to fix this. 

The product materials are strong and seem like they’ll last a few years. I like the pouches where I can store small items like gloves or bike tools.
review.name: Great way to transport bikes in my truck bed

review.reviewBody: I really like my new bike carrier. Keeps the bikes secure during travel to the trails.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Was able to use instantly, we’ll within 5 minutes as installation was a breeze. And the ability to secure your bikes within minutes allows for more time to bike.
review.name: Simplicity at its BEST!

review.reviewBody: I buy a lot of Thule products and love them all.  I just bought a new GateMate and love it.  Holds my bikes securely and without scratching them, unlike the other brands of pads my friends use.
review.name: Always Love Thule Products

name: GateMate Pro Tailgate Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Zoid Cell online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This little origami pouch is perfect for a mirrorless camera transportation. I have a camera body, extra lens, batteries, and few accessories and enough room left to feel contents are safe. I carry in the backpack or suitcase and haven’t had any issues (top of pouch can use a padding?) I also love the orange color material used it’s easy to locate everything inside even the pouch gets stuck bottom of my backpack. Well done Ranch! You are still crazy.
review.name: Camera case

review.reviewBody: Perfect for carrying my mini stove, cooking cup, fuel, spoon and 2 mountain house meals. Final test will be the week of 4th of July Colorado scouting trip.
review.name: Perfect size.

review.reviewBody: Purchased, have not yet used. Padding seems nice, closure is clever and easy to remove from pack. I like that it flattens for storage. An ideal piece for the top of the pack where you might put some electronics, or other fragile items.
review.name: Seems Functional!

review.reviewBody:
I use a Swaro ATS system in the field. I keep it in a case with 65 objective attached, but was looking around for a padded pouch to carry a Swaro 95 lens for my spotter as well when I need to reach out there. nobody has something like this so I went with this Zoid case and it works well enough. Quality and price were never a concern, MR has never left that to question. 
Maybe consider making pouches for this but I’ll be using the Zoid .
review.name: Close enough to perfect

review.reviewBody: Bought this a few weeks ago and it is a great padded organizer. Padding folds up easily and it’s the perfect size. Great quality and construction.
review.name: Great organizer

review.reviewBody: Perfect way to organize any kind of small gear. The padded sides add confidence. Super versatile piece.
review.name: Great padded organizer

review.reviewBody: For essentials and items needing some extra padding! Can’t beat it.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: Well padded and adequate size for a small to medium mirrorless camera or anything requiring extra protection. Fits nicely in Terraframe 65 bag.
review.name: Essential accessory

review.reviewBody: Got this thinking it would be awesome for my camera and it is  but its also great for my small cooking stuff and helps keep all quiet
review.name: Love this bag!!!!!!!!!!!!!I

review.reviewBody:
As a SAR team member, our gear takes a beating. Like most of you know, portable stove kits like JetBoil, MSR, and Camp Chef Stryker are costly, somewhat fragile, and come with nothing more than a mesh sack. The risk for damaging it somehow is legit.

Enter the Zoid Cell. Padded and sized to fit perfect in the bottom of most MR packs, I stash my Camp Chef Stryker 100 stove kit in here along with my fuel and all the hot drink and foot items needed. Even better is the hunter orange color that they just released so that it's easier to identify with all the other Zoid bags in my pack.
review.name: Excellent solution for stove kit!

name: Zoid Cell

review.reviewBody: Works great for me for when watching football games in the rain

review.reviewBody: The pants fit amazing. Also the shipping was timely!
review.name: I would definitely buy these pants again.

review.reviewBody: This is a well-designed pant. Unfortunately, the proportions are a bit off. As someone with a 33" waste, and being only 5'8", I can;t really find the right size. No worries, I'll be warm and dry, even if my baggy pants look a little too 1980s hip-hoppish.

review.reviewBody: Packed....just in case... on a White Mountain trip. They work well over light pants. A little long, although thankful they covered ankles and boot tops. 6', XXL

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for my husband who has always worn the really low profile model that no longer seems to be available. He's adjusting to this digger clog and I will report more when he's had a chance to wear them for a while.
review.name: Low cut replacement

review.reviewBody: My husband really likes these, but they are too big for him. They don't come in half sizes (10.5) and he didn't want to take a chance the 10's would be too small and have to pay another return shipping fee.
review.name: Well-Made But Too Big

review.reviewBody: Really enjoy these, they are very comfortable and durable. They keep out water and whatnot, as long as it is below the ankles (duh). Highly recommend these.
review.name: Great little slip ons

review.reviewBody: Have had ankle height slip on for years. Finally worn out. Higher cut will allow wear on deeper snow and make putting on easier. I have arthritis. And lugged soles keep me safe from slipping.
review.name: Winter wear, dry and safe, and warm.

review.reviewBody: I love bogs as a product, however each time I have made online purchase I have had to follow up after several weeks as purchase does not arrive and has to be resent. You have a supply information issue that needs to be addressed which is disappointing as a consumer.
review.name: Love bogs!

review.reviewBody: Took two exchanges to get the right fit but customer service and exchange process was awesome!
review.name: Finally the right size!

review.reviewBody: Runs big, had to size down. Otherwise they are the perfect yard/garden shoe.
review.name: Great Yard Shoe

review.reviewBody: Nice summer walking shoe. The shoe doesn't feel as comfortable as the Ultra Classic boots. Feels closer to a regular farm boot. Maybe a better liner.
review.name: Good but not as comfortable as expected

review.reviewBody: Really loose. I have several pair of Bogs and these are really wide. I'm not sure I'd have bought them if I had known. Still a nice boot.
review.name: Not the best fit.

review.reviewBody: Tried several brands and styles before scoring big on this shoe. Perfect for working in the garden and just what I was looking for.
review.name: Comfortable, easy on and off, perfect garden shoe.

name: Digger Slip On Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the SciCon Aerotech Evolution X TSA Case online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aerotech Evolution X TSA Case
hasVariant.description: Buy the SciCon Aerotech Evolution X TSA Case online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is the second travel bag I have owned and first hard shell.  So far so good.  The bag protected by bike and once I learned how to pack it, it became a quick process.  Major issue that everyone on the web talks about is the tie-down system.  These straps ripped on the first trip and I will have to go to home depot to see how I can better secure the bike.
review.name: Bike not broken!!! that is the key

review.reviewBody:
Finally started flying with this and it is amazing. It is well made and very intuitive. Importantly, TSA can figure out how to open and close it without screwing-up your bike. This is the most risky aspect for frame damage....the open/close when going through airport security. 

I bought a second one because I like it so much.
review.name: Love it

name: Aerotech Evolution X TSA Case

description: Buy the Petzl Aquila Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aquila Harness
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl Aquila Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: To prevent the left gear loops from ending up very far behind you, the harness needs to be tightened as far as it will go. My waist size is 31"-32", right in the middle of the medium size range, but the gear loops are far back enough that they are difficult to use.
review.name: Gear loops too far back

review.reviewBody:
Very light with plenty of room for gear.
I use it for sport and trad climbing, works well during the summer as it very light weight.
review.name: Great harness

review.reviewBody:
Harness feels great, and the gear loop situation is extremely fantastic. 
I've taken many whips with this harness.
My only issue is the small belay loop... it is HALF the width of 'regular' belay loops. I cannot find info about its mbs either which is weird.
I'm sure it's fine because I've belayed and rappelled more times than I can count with it, but it is something that sits in the back of my mind since day one. 
I'm currently in the process of modifying a second belay loop to install on the harness.
review.name: Great for trad climbing.

name: Aquila Harness

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful shoe that is comfortable to wear. Good cushion and fits just right
review.name: Awesome shoe

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was searching for a lightweight shoe that would actually keep my feet dry. These shoes were better than expected, and were comfy even during the first wear! I did buy my regular size in wide even though I usually dont wear wide fit, but the fit is perfect for thicker socks.
review.name: Truly waterproof!

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfy and super cute! Bit narrow for a wide fit though. I wish they were a touch wider especially on my toes. Bought an 11 could size up half a size but I think if I break them in they'll be fine
review.name: Gorgeous but narrowish

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am so disappointed - I thought I found the perfect shoe:  lightweight, waterproof, wide-width.  Unfortunately 1. These shoes are not waterproof - my foot/sock got soaked on a shallow creek crossing which resulted in a terrible blister. 2. These shoes are not durable - the thread from the bottom is worn off and falling off after a first rugged hike (after 6mo of occasional short hikes on flat trail)
review.name: NOT WATERPROOF, NOT DURABLE

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been a long time Columbia shoe buyer - winter boots, hiking, trail runners, and casual sneakers. I was ready for a new pair of waterproof hiking boots and purchased these in an 8W. For a wide they are really not roomy as others have commented, but I only have a slightly wide foot so they are doable (but not great). My biggest complaint is, I don't know what environment these were tested in for waterproofing, but it was not one that contained water. Walk for 2 minutes through dewy grass and your feet will be soaked. I even waterproofed them in an attempt to make these work - I think they lasted about 5 minutes. Not the quality I would expect from Columbia, now I just suffer on shorter walks with soaking wet shoes (think: you hear the water squishing each step) and deal with the swampy stink later.
review.name: 0% Waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love Columbia... However, toe box is small. The tred came off after three hikes. Sole is falling apart. Very waterproof but they won't do ya any good on a trail that's not walking through town unfortunately.
review.name: They fell apart after 3 hikes

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the first hiking boots I have bought. I was nervous to get a pair since I normally hike in tennis shoes, but decided I need more grip and ankle support to do tougher trails. These are the perfect hiking shoes for me because they are comfortable like tennis shoes. I hiked Seneca Rocks in WV (up 1,000 feet) and they were great. It rained the last 15 minutes and I stayed completely dry. I ordered .5 size up and they fit well.
review.name: Love these!

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wow this fit is laughable. I purchased the 9W and immediately knew these were going to be returned due to poor fit, poor sizing and absolutely not wide at all in width or instep.  I compared to my Hoka shoes that are also 9W and there is just no way the Columbia pair is wide, let alone a size 9.
review.name: Terrible fit (wide)

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this boot, tried it on w/ no sock, and it still felt tight. I am an 8.5 dealing w/ some foot problems, and these look so cozy. They do not have much cushion in the sole, and I got Wides, they did not feel wide at all - my pinky was rubbing against the side, and I didn't even have a sock on. The material and quality seems nice, but it fit small and no coziness to it.
review.name: Beautiful boot, but runs small

review.itemreviewed: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: True to size. Could be wider? Yes, but still comfortable!
review.name: Great shoes

name: Trailstorm Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Allure Mips Helmet online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I haven't had a chance to wear it on the slopes yet, but trying it on now I was happy with how well it fit. Trying other Smith models I know they tend to size smaller than other brands but this one fit perfect. Love the adjustability in the dial for added support and appreciate the optional ear coverings.
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody: Pads were very soft and seemed comfy but I meticulously measured my kid's head before ordering. The helmet should fit his head but was too small.
review.name: Not true to size.  Too small

review.reviewBody:
Not a review of the helmet as I have had this model in the past and love it. But I’m super disappointed in the service from Backcountry - I ordered this helmet over three weeks ago and it was never picked up by USPS. Custy service confirmed that it never shipped and was lost, but that there wasn’t a replacement available because it was sold out. They offered me a swap of another (not near as nice) helmet instead. When I asked about a comparable model, they said I could have it but I’d have to pay the difference (I ordered the first one during a big sale), which would have been over 50 bucks more.  Not mad at custy service because they’re always great, but this kinda sucks and makes me feel like I’m being penalized for a mistake I didn’t make. 

But the helmet is great, I was ordering the same one I had before (which took enough hits that it was time to get a new one) - size chart is accurate and it’s light and super comfy!
review.name: Never Got It - Disappointed With Service

review.reviewBody:
Great healmet ventlation was a must it got it
True size and fits perfect with my kids googles! Amazing look
review.name: A must own

review.reviewBody: I love the design and look of this helmet. The only issue I have is that my head is in between the size of a small and medium so it doesn't fit quite right. If it had the dial on the back, it would be perfect. The code is the closest helmet I have seen design wise that is similar with the dial on the back of the helmet.
review.name: Looks good

review.reviewBody: Great helmet! Feels very comfortable. Incredible quality!
review.name: Great helmet! Feels very comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I don’t like helmets and don’t like to wear them. This helmet was great. I could forget that I had it on. I was super surprised and impressed with the comfort. You can have your headphones inside the ear flaps also. The quality of the helmet was superb.
review.name: Best helmet

review.reviewBody: I haven't had a chance to use the helmet yet but it fits perfectly and is extremely comfortable. I'm looking forward to getting back to the snow so I can give it a try. I know I'll be safer wearing the helmet.
review.name: I haven't had a chance

review.reviewBody: The fit is good. I wish the helmet had a knob in the back that you could adjust the fit depending if you are wearing a skull cap or not.
review.name: The fit is good. I

review.reviewBody: I'm very happy with my product. I feel very comfortable. I love the design, the details, the structure in which the helmet is designed very hot and I like it like that, thank you
review.name: I'm very happy with my

name: Allure Mips Helmet

review.itemreviewed: COOL Mesh Superlight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I’ve been wearing these for years, every ride, every time. On the trainer, it’s my only top layer and on outdoor rides it’s the “first” layer. Improves comfort of bib straps and disappears once on. For such a thin, soft material it also holds up really well over time. I have a half dozen of these and the oldest is probably 8 seasons old and still kicking. 
Regarding sizing, I’m generally a L in cycling jerseys but find the M in this to be perfect. So if you’re between sizes, I’d size down.
review.name: A must-have for me

review.itemreviewed: COOL Mesh Superlight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought one of these and just keep buying them. Only dig maybe is they sort of lose shape well before the material shows any signs of wear.

Please don't change this and I will keep buying them.
review.name: My one and only

review.itemreviewed: COOL Mesh Superlight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody: Maybe one of the best baselayers I've ever worn. Comfortable, well constructed, fits just right, material seems to be of quality, delivers ample breathability, keeps you cool, prevents bib straps from chaffing your shoulders. Just an excellent product. Buying another one.
review.name: Incredible baselayer

review.itemreviewed: COOL Mesh Superlight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wear it on every ride from October to May and never regret it. I don't find it helpful or necessary on hot rides, but also doesn't hurt if a cold day heats up.
review.name: Love

review.itemreviewed: COOL Mesh Superlight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bottom line: Wearing the Craft base-layer under my riding jersey, and also under my bib-straps makes me feel more comfortable over time.

Pros: The base-layer is comfortable. It prevents chaffing from my bib-shorts' straps. It feels better than having a shirt on without it. I do not know if it keeps me cooler than without it as promised, but I definitely feel less "clammy" after a hard workout.

Cons: None really. It is another item to buy, another item to put on, another item to wash after finishing the workout.
review.name: A skeptic turned believer

review.itemreviewed: COOL Mesh Superlight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought two of these about a year ago, and bought two more a couple months ago.  Very stretchy material.  These are really lightweight and thin and good for riding in hot weather or year round here in Florida.  Seem to hold up well over time as the ones year old seem as good as new.
review.name: Good summer base layer

name: COOL Mesh Superlight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's

description: Buy the Fjallraven Ulvo Rolltop 30L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ulvo Rolltop 30L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Ulvo Rolltop 30L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this bag for over 18 months and use it every day for work. It still is in immaculate condition - looks and performs the same as when I bought it. Excellent durability! Lots of useful features like the side bottle pockets. I love the roll top because it keeps my laptop safe and dry, and it’s deceptively roomy. Highly recommended. I also have another Fjallraven backpack that I used daily for work for years, and it’s still going strong. I think they’re the best laptop backpacks around, and I haven’t even been paid to say this.
review.name: 18 months + and still immaculate

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bag 18 months ago and I love it so much I want to buy it again every time I see an ad about it, before realising I already have one.
It is perfectly water resistant, it has a lot of space to pack, but you can also bring it onboard on low-cost flights, making it the perfect bag for weekend travels.
review.name: The perfect backpack

review.reviewBody:
I have purchased this very expensive bag, which has lasted less than a year. In essence the main plastic buckle has snapped. 
Although the bag is aesthetically really nice, impermeable, comfortable and with good volume, I wouldn’t recommend this bag given that other than the broken buckle, I am also noticing some seams not looking great, and the strap seams too are starting to loosen up.
review.name: Comfy yes, but not sturdy

review.reviewBody: Great bag for every day use. However after a few months of use, the mesh on the straps began to fray. Pretty disappointed when I brought it in and they told me nothing could be done.
review.name: Fraying mesh material

review.reviewBody: This pack is great! It is very comfortable to wear, waterproof, and super versatile. The rolltop is easy to use and the pack looks great. The interior is minimal by design but does have a laptop compartment and small interior pocket. It is 30 liters but is not an overly large bag so it could easily work for every day use.
review.name: Take anywhere bag!

review.reviewBody:
This is an excellent rolltop backpack. I love the yellow color. Very comfortable, high quality, weatherproof, lightweight, huge water bottle pocket. But I ended up returning it after a couple days of work and school commuting and use. It does not have enough pockets and I keep losing items in the spacious interior. One more pocket on the outside and a hole for a hydration hose and it would the perfect backpack. 
This backpack would be perfect for maybe a bike commuter (good in all weather and a narrow fit). Or this backpack is for you if you're the kind of person who can pack their bag without forgetting a million things, roll it up, and be set to leave the house. It is just too inconvenient to unroll it and shove in a rain jacket or phone charger as you walk out of the door.
review.name: Excellent pack but not for me

name: Ulvo Rolltop 30L Daypack
